You feel yourself growing hard and wanting to travel your hands down her curves, you fight the urge and pull away before things really escalate. She pouts a little while you gasp and put in some distance.

"Aw...what's the matter? I thought you'd be happier to see me now?"

Though she is only playing, there is a greater love in her eyes now that the individuals that constitute her have heard their brother accept the consequences. Rebekah had enough influence into Emma's thought process to provide some pushback but now, Emma feels free enough to be happy with herself and her love which has doubled.

Catching your breath, you give a worried smile. "Well, I am. Rather, I want my sisters to be happy, that's all."

Emma's expression soften. "You're too sweet, you know that?"

She raises her hands like claws and then creeps closer to you with a grin. "But if you don't want what's coming for you, then I suggest you run."

"Not so fast," Angeline interrupts, placing a hand on the fusion's shoulder. "Food is almost ready."

Reminded of Angeline, Emma grows guilty and then turns her attention away from you. In turn, you breathe a little easier, but some part of you wanted to allow the fusion to embrace you. Although you haven't merged with your sisters yet, the urge to do so lingers in the back of your mind.

Between both fusions that stand face to face, Angeline starts out with a sad smile. "I'm sorry, by the way."

Emma curls her lips, her eyes starting to water. "I...I'm sorry too, mom. You were right though...I was jealous. I thought that I would be closest to my brother and then...you just showed up."

Angeline lowers her gaze, then hugs her double-daughter. She gives a shaky breath. "I love your brother too. I know exactly what you're going through but I also know that I'm not completely family here. I shouldn't delay any further here though. You deserve to see your real mother, not some impersonator."

Pulling away, Angeline slowly takes away the necklace from Emma. She doesn't resist but does feel guilty. Still, she knows that Nicole is dominant within Angeline and even though she hasn't met Arianna in person, it seems unfair to the girl.

Angeline sighs as she stares at Emma and you, then puts on the necklace. "I don't know what will happen, but if what I feel from Arianna is real, then she has a deep desire to belong to this family. Yet, Scott is right. We can't ignore our real lives."

Taking a deep breath, she closes her eyes. The necklace glows in response to her will and in a clean fashion, you see Arianna splitting away from Nicole.

Dazed, Arianna fumbles a bit and you move to catch her, giving her time to stabilize while on her feet rather than on the ground. You're a bit worried she'll get mad like before but instead, she shakes and slowly wraps her arms around you.

Trying to keep herself as composed as possible, she breathes shakily onto you. Not sure what to do, you just remain still as she tries to recollect herself. It seems like at any moment, she's going to break down and cry, but to your surprise, she doesn't. She just remains silent for a while.

Nicole takes time to recollect herself too, but she recovers faster having used the necklace a few times now. She glances towards Arianna with guilt and worry. When her eyes and yours meet, she quickly looks away.

You curl your lips the return your focus to the girl. "Are you...okay?"

Arianna slowly nods. Nicole and Emma keep their distance, not wanting to break any glass as the girl tries to remain together. Slowly, she nods and pulls away. While still tugging at your arms, she turns her head to look at Nicole. Small tear streaks mark her face and then she frowns.

"That...wasn't at all what I felt before."

Nicole's eyes widen and she knows the girl is referring to when she merged with Scott as Celestine.

Biting her lips, Nicole couldn't help but defend herself. "I...had no choice. What did you expect?"

Arianna's eyes lower and she gives a bitter smile. "I'm in the wrong too, I know. I just..."

Her face tightens as she tries to find the words. She finally looks at you, a small warmth growing on her complexion. "When we were Celestine, even if it was forced, I never felt such synchronicity with someone ever before. I...I wanted that again...I wanted to get to know you better! I thought that if I merged with your mother, I could get to know you on a deeper level."

Emma looks on, agitation building up but quickly, Nicole places a comforting hand on her shoulder. She shakes her head silently.

"...and for that, I'm sorry," she said, her hands quivering, "I know I've caused problems."

Nicole's eyes soften. Her maternal instincts couldn't get mad at the girl and even sympathized with her, especially after merging. "Dear...come here."

Arianna shakes her head and back away, knowing if she gets hugged by your mother, she would definitely break down. Yet, Nicole doesn't heed and only sees a girl that needs comfort.

Hugging the girl, Arianna finally gives into her tears and hugs back. Now, you back away and stand beside Emma who grows conflicted. It's clear she doesn't know how to feel about this girl anymore.

After some comfort is exchanged between the previously fused females, they break away.

What is going to happen?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Emma 2.0

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Arianna calms down greatly after crying out. Yet, as she believes that it's over, Nicole offers a compromise.

"Arianna, I'll be honest here. I'd like to merge with you again...this time properly; however, you're young and it's easy to want some access to escape. I look into your memories though and you have such loving parents and a nice relationship with your boyfriend. Why would you want to throw that away?"

Arianna knits her brows together and looks down, guilt plaguing her face. "Everything has been just...boring. I love my parents, but I've always felt like I'm missing something. I could never explain it myself and always go through the motions. My boyfriend is nice, but...it's clear we aren't compatible with each other. He wants to go to a different direction than I do and knowing that, I don't think I can be with him. Plus, it's only been three months, you know?"

She looks towards you and then smiles. "But it felt different when I was with you. Maybe that's just the necklace doing, but I felt like I was truly alive!"

You blush and rub your neck, embarrassed. "Um...glad you think of me like that. I can't say I don't like you, but um..."

Arianna didn't need you to say anything more. She nods. "I know, things are crazy and I probably didn't help with that when I merged with your mom. Despite not being dominant as Angeline, I felt a little happy being with you."

Nicole clears her throat, blushing herself. "While my son is single, let's not get ahead of ourselves here. First, your parents must be worried sick! I'm partly to blame here for not unmerging sooner. You must talk with your parents first! How are you going to explain this?"

Arianna rubs her arm and curls her lips as she thinks. "Well...this isn't the first time I've gone out. Of course, usually, I tell them beforehand but I can say I met up with one of my friends at the party and spent the night over there and forgot to let them know. They might be upset, but they're pretty chill."

Nicole breathes easily. "As long as you have an excuse. The last thing I want is to be framed for kidnapping."

She moves to grab the keys to the car and then looks at you. You can see some conflict in her eyes as she stares at you, but she keeps calm.

"S-scott...Emma, I'm going to take her home. I may or may not come back with her depending on how things go. In any case, she'll have my number in case she reaches out to contact us."

You and Emma nod. Before leaving with Arianna, she takes off the necklace and gives it to you. She gives a stern eye at you.

"If your father comes back, I'd like things not to get messy, do you understand?"

You nod hesitantly and Emma smiles innocently.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Real life must come first.

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
After your mother and Arianna leaves, you take a deep breath.

"This is not good for my heart," you mutter to yourself.

"Did you say something, Scott?" Emma leans forward with a hum, smiling devilishly.

You flinch and then cough. "I mean, nothing! I guess we just wait til mom gets back home, right?"

"...or we can take the time to know each other better. What do you say?" she asks, leaning closer to you and placing a hand around your hip.

"S-sis, we...shouldn't," you reply, shivering. You grip the necklace tightly in your hands.

Emma frowns. "Is that because you think of me as your sister?"

"Well, yeah! You're both of them!"

"I think that thinking is wrong. After all, that didn't stop you from giving into Angeline's advances. Why is that?"

"I...don't know," you breathe as she slowly slides her hand across your stomach. You pull away and try to explain better, "...I was confused and...she wanted to merge with me. I didn't think that was a good idea at the time, but I..."

Emma chuckles. "Oh, you're so silly. How about we make things easier. I'm not your sister. Only Rebecca and Emily is your sister, make sense? Thes same goes to Angeline since its clear it wasn't completely Nicole. I bet that's why you couldn't resist!"

"But...but..."

Emma hushes you, then smiles warmly. "Scott, Emily and Rebecca tried their hardest to keep their emotions at bay, but the necklace wants us to embrace it! It's so much easier to forget about what makes a relationship if you think of me as a new person."

She opens her arms wide and smiles. "Scott, I love you. They may be started because of Rebecca and Emily, but I don't feel their love for you...I feel my love for you."

What do you do?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Keep Scott's POV

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
As she draws closer to you, your mind races at what you should do. Is this okay? How would this affect the family?

You love your sisters and even if this girl believes herself to be someone separate from your sisters, it may make things worse emotionally for them when they unmerge.

Despite your worries, you feel your member hardening the longer you stare at Emma's busty form. You glance at the necklace and frown.

'Maybe...it's the necklace that's compelling me...'

Or it could just be teenage hormones, but you wanted some excuse.

"How about I merge with you instead? Would that satisfy you?" you ask.

Emma widens her eyes. "Y-you...want to merge with me?"

The mood unexpectedly becomes worrisome as the fusion loses her cheer. She bites her lips as she thinks and then drops her arms.

"I don't know if that's a good idea, Scott."

Huh?

"I'd didn't expect to hear that from you!" you exclaim.

Emma's brows meet as she explains, a little confused herself. "I mean, it's complicated. What if...we never meet each other again?"

You look at her incredulously. "Are you serious? What about my sisters?!"

Emma growls. "I know that! In fact, it's different from last time. Although it's a little scary, I've already unmerged once and...well, I feel confident this time that I'll be back. I don't know what will happen though if we become a three-person fusion and that...worries me. Maybe I'm just scared about the thought of losing...well, me."

You have no answer for her but it seems she's still thinking. After a few seconds in silence, her face softens. "Scott...if you're confident about this, then...I'd be happy to merge with you. I trust you."

Her eyes narrow as she smiles, "...but don't think this let's you off the hook in my eyes."

You laugh nervously but feel happy to hear such trust from your "non-sister". You take a deep breath.

"Alright here goes then. Get ready, Emma."

She opens her arms wide and gives a slightly worried smile. "I am."

You put on the necklace and then will yourself to merge with Emma. Walking closer to her, she wraps her arms around you, then locks lips with you.

You utter a muffled groan and can't help but place your hands around her bottom. She squirms with glee and then, everything goes dark.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----

A new fusion gasps. She stares at the ground, dazed until she notices her lack of clothes.

She frowns. "Why?"

Perhaps the necklace has an odd sense of humor.

Ignoring that, she moves to the master bathroom and peaks into the mirror and raises her eyebrows.

Preview  

"Wow!" she breathes and rotates, humming.

"Not as busty as Emma or Angeline, but...I guess that makes sense."

She smiles, chuckling to herself. "Of course, there's only a little bit of Scott from what I can see, but the two sisters are definitely dominating my looks...probably."

She takes a breath, then frowns. "...and now I have to look for some new clothes. Luckily, it seems like I would fit Emma's clothes. Hope she won't mind."

She pauses, then shakes her head silly. "Of course she won't. I'm making the judgment right now probably based on her influence and memories."

"...and I'm talking to myself, trying to find reason in my actions thanks to Rebekah and Scott."

She hums and narrows her eyes. "I think I should shut up now and go find some clothes."

----------------------------------------------------------------

"Let's see...Scott and Emma...or rather Scott, Rebekah and Emily. What should I call myself?" she muses as she puts on a casual blue dress that she could simply fit over. Oddly enough, she doesn't feel too picky about clothes and that's likely because Scott isn't picky. He's a boy after all.

As she thinks of a name, something comes to the front of her mind. She opens her mouth in horror. "Oh shit! The pasta!"

Quickly moving back into the kitchen, the pot is already boiling. Quickly, she pours strains the pasta that she hopes won't turn out overcooked and then sets it to dry. She begins cutting some vegetables that she would then mix with the pasta and reheat, stirring.

Between the aroma that fills her nose, she finally decides on a name with a smile. "Gemelli...because why not? Who doesn't love pasta?"

Adding a pinch of salt, her mind wanders and time passes quickly before she realizes.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Merge with her.

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Gemelli's minds wander far too long. Oddly, Nicole should be back given how close Arianna's home is. She couldn't be talking with her parents, could she?

There's a more important problem though that comes straight home. A knock on the door makes her jump. At first, she wondders if it's Nicole, but she would have come in from the back since she has a car to park. Considering how things went at the company gathering last night and the word that Daniel got too drunk around when Scott and Nicole left, it would make sense he would come back home without his car. His friends probably didn't want him driving.

"Er...anyone home?" Daniel called out in a muffled voice behind the door, "...I tried calling, but nobody picked up. Hello?!"

"Oh shit!" Gemelli curses, panicking.

As she is now, she's practically a stranger! What should she do?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Daniel finally comes back home.

choices: Scott, Emily, and Rebekah all split away.
Only Scott is pushed away and Emma reforms.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
"No, I can't continue just merging endlessly! Everyone but him now knows about the necklace and maybe that's for the best," she mutters to herself.

With that in mind, she has to at least unmerge. Taking a deep breath, she quickly goes into the bathroom and looks into a mirror. She smiles sadly.

"Well, it was nice knowing me. Hopefully, I'll come back soon."

Her hands are shaking, but she knows that because she herself is comprised of family, their bonds is strong enough that she feels confident she'll come back together in the near future.

With that, she lets herself go. What happens?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Unfuse!

choices: They all merge back to Gemelli.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Rebekah splits away, her eyes shut tightly as she groans. As much as she enjoyed becoming a part of Gemelli and understood that they needed to be more careful, she feels a bit annoyed.

Neither Scott nor Nicole bothered to try maintaining some secrecy because they assumed it would be difficult to keep it from herself and Emily. Yet, now that they've merged and unfused between each other, there's an increase in confidence that they might be able to maintain some normalcy between them.

'Seems kind of unfair to dad, but I guess we'll at least try until we fail.' she thinks.

Opening her eyes, she expected that her little brother and sister would think the same but instead, she gets a new fusion surprise.

Preview  

It doesn't take a genius to know that she has been left out and Rebekah growls. "Are you fucking kidding me?! I thought we were on the same page!"

The fusion smirks. "Well, only one of us needs to greet dad. Just in case, just let him know that you have a friend over - Kayla."

Rebekah narrows her eyes but she couldn't complain as the door is knocked. Grunting in frustration, she pats herself off and points at Kayla.

"Fine! Once this is over though, you've either got to let me back in or unfuse!"

Kayla sticks her tongue out. "No promises~"

Rebekah rolls her eyes and quickly exits the bathroom, hurrying to the front door. She smiles wide towards her father who equally smiles in relief.

"Hey dad! Welcome back!"

Daniel lets out a sigh as he comes in, loosening his tie and wrinkled dress suit. "Thanks Rebekah. I had to be dropped off by one of my coworkers. I tried calling, but nobody picked up! I started to get worried. I also didn't see Nicole at the party!"

Rebekah seals her lips, trying to think of a cover based on the shared memories of the party. Closing the door behind her, she speaks up.

"Um...well, mom wasn't feeling good. She probably forgot to call and went straight to bed. Emily is...still out with her friends and um...Scott is too. I've been uh...studying with my friend, Kayla who's here with me in the house."

Daniel relaxes on the living room couch and raises his eyebrow, surprised. "So everyone is busy with their own things, huh?"

He closes his eyes and sighs. "...well, I'm not mad, just so you know. I got a little hungover with my colleagues and so, things were crazy on my end. Anyways, I'm just glad everyone is alright. You mentioned someone is here?"

If possible, Rebekah doesn't want Kayla to have to come out. "Yes, but don't worry about her! Everyone should be back soon though."

Daniel hums, then stretches a little before standing up. "Well, I've still got a bit of a headache now, so...I'm going to try sleeping it off. Is that pasta I'm smelling?"

Rebekah glances over towards the adjacent kitchen and smiles. "Sure is! Is that going to be a problem?"

Daniel chuckles. "Hopefully not. It's been a while since all of us had a chance to eat together at the table. I know you've been busy with your college while I've been busy with work. Since you're on break, it'll be nice to see everyone's faces at once. That is if I can get rid of this splitting headache."

Rebekah places a relaxing hand on her father's back. "It'll be okay, Dad. Just rest for now. You clearly outdid yourself!"

Daniel laughs weakly. "That's for sure. Alright then, I'll see you in a bit, sweetie."

Rebekah watches his father retreat to the master bedroom and when the door shut behind, she lets out a heavy sigh.

"...I hope everyone's normal faces are there too," she mutters.

Kayla peaks from behind a wall and then whistles. "See, that didn't go so bad?"

Rebekah growls and turns her attention towards the fusion. "It certainly would have gone better if I had my brother and sister at my side to greet him!"

"Well, then we'd have problems on why we haven't been picking up the phone," Kayla glances to the side.

"I don't want to hear it," Rebekah scoffs.

What happens now?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Only Rebekah is pushed away!

choices: Emily and Scott unfuse. They have a chat.
More fusion fanfare between Emily, Scott, and Rebekah.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Now that Daniel had gone back to his room in hopes of recovering from his headache, Rebekah was about to demand to be let back into Kayla until the backdoor opened.

"Jeez, that was far more trouble than it was wor-"

Nicole halts as she sees Rebekah and an entirely new girl she hasn't seen. Of course, her first guess is...

"Scott and...Emily?"

Kayla grins. "Hi Mom!"

Rebekah sighs and crosses her arms. "You missed out when we were all fused together. Dad just came back home though is taking a little bit more time to rest from his apparent hungover. It seems I'm the only one kicked out."

Nicole flinches. "Y-your father? Wait, he didn't-"

Rebekah gets ahead of her thought. "No, don't worry, mom! We didn't expose him to the necklace. Luckily, he bought my cover as for why everyone didn't pick up their phones. I told him that this fusion, Kayla is my friend I'm 'studying' with."

Nicole curls her lips, guilty. "That's my fault too, I suppose, but I'm glad he's alright. I won't disturb him but in the meantime, I want everyone to remain normal, understood?"

Kayla frowns. "It hasn't even been an hour! I literally just popped into existence five minutes ago!"

Nicole closes her eyes and sighs. She's about to argue with her fusion of a daughter/son but then she stops. At the thought of her son, Scott, her heart is riddled with guilt. When she was merged with Ariana as Angeline, though she had majority control, she was different enough to embrace her son in absence of fusion. Perhaps fusion would've been the better option but at that moment, neither she nor Scott knew if they would ever unfuse.

It's still a fear in her mind too. She felt the reluctance herself and saw the reluctance when both of her daughters fused. It honestly relieved her to see that they at least managed to split halfway and not bring in their father to this chaotic mix. It almost makes her regret not believing they could have kept it a secret from Emily and Rebekah.

'I...I can't look at my son right now. It's still...confusing for me.' she thinks.

Recomposing herself, she pretends that she's fine. "Kayla, is it? Please keep it quiet and I expect that you'll unfuse when it's time to eat."

Kayla smiles wide, then moves to hug her mother. Nicole takes it with ease, knowing that this girl isn't purely Scott. That said, she does want to see her son, but first wants to sort out her feelings better...not as Angeline, but his mother, Nicole.

For now, Kayla and Rebekah goes into their own rooms and she finishes up the cooking of the pasta. She tries to distract herself as the day slowly comes to an end.

Close to dinner time, what happens?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Nicole comes back home alone.

choices: You put away the necklace for now. Nicole calls for dinner.
You skip dinner and try to go out for a walk to clear your head.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Emily and Scott have always been close. Given that they are only a year apart, it makes sense but the biggest reason is that they share a lot in common in terms of likes.

As a young girl, Emily has never been one to play with dolls or pretend. Rather, she found a love for video games and reading science fiction novels thanks to her brother. As a result, they could talk together about various things easily.

Of course, there are differences. Emily has always been the most physically active out of the family. It can be said that despite enjoying time inside the house with her brother, she enjoys going to the gym and running with her track team members.

Neither of them is here though. Instead, Kayla exists in place of them and to the shared interests of her personalities, she is taking time to play a video game that was sitting in Scott's room, one that neither of them could beat alone but perhaps it would be different this time now that she had their collective knowledge.

Except, it isn't. Zero progress plus zero progress doesn't mean any new progress.

"Ah, fuck!"

Kayla throws the controller and shuts off the console. She glances at the time on the alarm clock of Scott's drawer and frowns.

"Well...here's to me," she sighs, standing up and looks into a nearby mirror next to several posters. "Seriously, if I wasn't family, I'd have a hard time splitting."

On that note, she closes her eyes and breathes in. Soon, Kayla disappears and in her place, you and Emily reappear into existence, groaning with your minds dazed. You share a bit of skin but it spreads thin between you and her while your clothes rematerialize.

It takes a bit. Emily is the most reluctant to defuse as she clings to her you but eventually, you and her fumble back within the center of their room with a gasp.

"O-oh...wow..." you breathe, leaning against a wall.

Emily likewise tries to regain her sense of surroundings, slowly sitting at your bedside. She places a hand to her forehead and groans.

"I feel a little sick..."

At the risk of having to change your bedsheets, you quickly refocus yourself. "Don't you dare, Emily."

Emily lets out a short laugh and manages to cool herself. Then, she raises her head, catching your eyes. A small guilty smile plagues her face.

"Scott, thank you."

You smile back, more confidently. "You feeling better?"

Emily curls her lips and then moves her head side to side. "I guess? I...I would say I feel better, but..."

Her eyes glisten as she breathes in, a little shaky before continuing. "...this feeling inside of me, it makes me wish I wasn't your sister."

You widen your eyes. "Emily..."

Emily snorts and shakes her head sadly. "We've always been close, Scott and I consider you my best friend; however, thanks to the necklace, other people have gotten close to you as well. Suddenly, it feels like I have to compete. I know it shouldn't be this way and I know that my feelings shouldn't grow any further, but...it's hard. The necklace has done something to all of us that can't seem to reversed."

Now guilt starts to grow in your mind. "Emily, I'm to blame here as well, I-"

"Hey, you've blamed yourself plenty," Emily cuts you off, "...what's done is done. I may not be as strong as Rebekah is mentally, but...I just have to do my best. Whatever happens, I just have to remember that you're my brother...unless..."

Silence grows and you feel goosebumps as Emily's eyes widen. Her lips quiver.

"...unless...I merge with someone so that I'm a different person...someone that's not your sister. Someone who's free to love you."

"E-emily, stop. That's not funny," you hurriedly protest.

Emily closes her eyes and sighs; she lets herself fall flat on your bed and stares at the ceiling, deep in thought before reopening them.

"Scott, I'm sorry...but I'm serious here."

"Emily, I don't want to have this conversation now," you plead.

Emily lifts herself up and clenches the bedsheet as stares at you, astonished. "What's wrong with it, huh? Why did you lose yourself when Nicole and Ariana were fused? Did you resonate with Angeline that much?! Were you so resistant when Rebekah and I were fused? Was it because we just doubled even further as your sister?"

Asking so many questions, you can tell Emily just wants to understand because fusing with you hasn't provided her any answers. You bite your lips.

"You know the answer, Emily," you answer softly, "...I can't exactly explain it."

Emily's body quivers and her hands relax. She grunts in displeasure. "This is so unfair. Thinking on it, you resonated with Gina...and almost let her remain as our mother!"

"L-let's not talk about that. Again, it was-"

"-complicated, I get it. I'm not blaming you, Scott. I just..." Emily pauses before speaking softly, "...I want to make you happy. I want to be happier and...I'm feeling that the best way is to become someone I'm not, someone better...just like Angeline."

Silence once again invades your room. Certainly, the mood has turned awkward but given your previous conversation with her after she defused from Rebekah, it's not so surprising."

You clear your throat. "Whatever happens though, we shouldn't ignore our lives. It's so easy to, but the reality doesn't change for us."

Emily hums. "I get it. I really do. I'm not saying I'll live as a fusion forever but maybe...I can live as your sister one day and then someone like Angeline the next. Would that be too much?"

You let out a shaky breath. "It'd be fucked up."

Emily chuckles sadly. "...but we're already fucked up...except for Dad. I'm not expecting you to give an answer, but...just know I'm not going to give up on getting close to you outside of fusing with you."

Leaving at that, Emily hops away from your bed and moves to hug your stunned form. Her declaration doesn't make you feel any better about the way things are progressing, but you can't just reject her outright. Rather than that, you're actually scared that it may go her way.

If a fusion appears like Angeline that you're weak to, you might even forget the parts that make up the fusion. During the moment with Angeline for sure, you completely forgot she was partly your mother and it's clear it was the same for her.

Emily silently breaks away from you and exits your room. With the door closed, you just keep your mouth closed and stare down at the necklace which has fallen to the ground during Emily and your defusion.

What do you do?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Emily and Scott unfuse. They have a chat.

choices: Daniel announces he has to go on a business trip.
A knock on the front door. Who could it be?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
You sigh, unable to come to any conclusion on what you really want. Although you may be yourself now, it feels like the presence of others still pervades through you as well as their feelings.

You could deny it all you want, but you could feel Emily's growing love for you. It's not just her - Rebekah, Nicole, Gina, Ariana.

From family to strangers, a bond is created that doesn't go away even after splitting. Suddenly, you are faced with the desire of others to want to be with you, some more than others.

As for yourself, you definitely feel an emotional bond to everyone but it's hardly equal. Perhaps that's why you could resist Emma's advances much less your sisters.

Maybe that's because they are your family; however, things go pretty south when someone outside of the family fuses with another.

Gina and Angeline...you felt something for them. The desire to see them again grows and that's a problem because they all revolve around Nicole, your mother - someone you fused with the first time and indirectly made love to.

If Emily truly merged herself with someone else, would it be the same? Are you allowed to feel this way because the fusion has broken from a sense of family?

Quickly, you take the necklace and throw it into your drawer. Shutting it and breathing unevenly, you take a moment to compose yourself while your hands shake.

Arianna nodded and then curled her lips before she leans forward and pecks you on the lips. You are initially surprised, but you quickly calm and kiss her back with a smile. After everything so far, it shouldn't be surprised to see some affection from the girl.

While rubbing her arm as encouragement, Arianna settles down to the living room couch and then curls into a ball, waiting for the pain pills to take effect.

You sigh, not feeling quite well yourself but you have to remain strong knowing that your sister and mother are probably in a living hell.

Sure enough, they couldn't even make it to the kitchen as both of them were still writhing in your bed. You went ahead and grabbed some glasses of water with some pills.

On arrival, they desperately took anything they could get and gulped down the pills within seconds at your bedside.

Both of them gasps at the same time, refreshed but not yet in the clear of the unexpected hangover. Emily is the first to speak, grabbing her head while one eye is closed.

"I...ung....don't get it. Is this because of the strange dream world or the fact we all fused together?"

You widened your eyes at her question and realized she's asking her mother, yet the implications are clear to you. Despite not seeing them, they were somewhere in that strange white void too!

"Wait, I was there too! Where were you guys?" you ask.

Nicole winces and then waves her hand at you, grunting. "S-sweetie, not so loud. L-let's talk after we've all recovered, okay?"

You smack your forehead, bashing yourself for being so thoughtless. Seeing that everyone would be able to think better, including yourself, you nod and leave your mother and sister alone in the room as they get their bearings.

----------------------------------------

An hour later, everyone had recovered and lessened their headaches to the point where they could think a bit clearly.

After changing into some clothes and taking a shower, everyone waits in the living room and an awkward silence slices through the room. Each one of them shifts uncomfortably, especially when you come back.

You curl your lips and break the silence. "Uh...where's Rebekah?"

Nicole speaks with a dry smile. "She's gone for a study group during this morning. Truthfully, I'm glad she didn't fuse with us."

You are glad as well that Rebekah declined Selena's offer as it could mean that the splitting headache for everyone would be much worse.

Everyone nodded and then Emily spoke up, causing everyone to flinch. "So...what now?"

What now?

You look at your sister incredulously. After that hangover feeling, you were reluctant to do any further fusion. Before you could open your mouth, Nicole switched topics while clearing her throat.

"I think we should talk about that dream world. If I'm not mistaken, it seems we were all in the same white space, right?"

Everyone nodded and you furrow your eyebrows. "...but I didn't see you guys. I only saw...um...Angeline and Selena."

Hearing you hesitate, each female narrowed their eyes at you. Emily is the first to beckon you to continue with a small smirk.

"...and?"

You blush and then shake your head. "It's not important."

Emily frowns. "Aw, well...it's okay. It's quite obvious based on your face, you pervert."

'She's calling me a pervert?' you think in disbelief but see that she's clearly teasing.

"Well, on our side," Arianna spoke up, "...I met up with Nicole and Emily and surprisingly Elle. We figured you might be somewhere, but we couldn't find you."

"It seems you, Angeline, and Selena weren't loud enough," Emily quips.

"Emily!" Nicole calls out disapprovingly.

Emily glances away, but you can see a tiny blush on your cheeks and a small pout. You really don't want to think on what her expression means.

"Well, what I've learned from talking with Elle is that our fusion forms are more separate than we thought," Arianna explained, shuffling her legs together. She held a cup of tea in her hands.

"Huh..."

You can't figure out any other explanation either and it's difficult for you to conjure any implications this knowledge might have.

"Regardless, I..."

Nicole hesitates before staring into your eyes with a small blush on her face, "...I truly enjoyed being Angeline. I know this is strange as I'm your mother but...thank you, son."

Hearing your mother's words cause you to blush. The more you look at her, the more you notice how much better her complexion is. It's like she shed five years off her age and either that's just because she's feeling happier than she's ever felt before or the necklace is working its magic.

Emily turns a little red and drops her cheeky act, growing serious. "Scott, me too. Thank you for loving all of us."

You'd rather not think about it too much but hearing such honest feelings makes you doubt less the events that occurred.

Looking at Arianna, Nicole, and Emily, you force the words out of your mouth. "I...love you all too."

The girls look at each other, then giggle to themselves causing you feel more self-conscious. Quickly wanting to return to the matter on hand, you clear your throat.

"So...I guess we should take a break, right?"

What are the girls' response?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Fusion Hangover

choices: Onward to the amusement park! Follow Emila and Scott.
Follow Nicole as she receives a surprise when taking a nap.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
"...actually," Emily begins, pursuing her lips for a moment before glancing at Arianna, "...I'd like to merge with Arianna only this time."

You widen your eyes. "Are you serious? Isn't it too soon?"

Arianna is rather surprised by Emily's request as well; however, having merged with her, she can understand Emily's feelings. With approval, she nods.

"I don't mind."

Emily expresses her gratitude. With the weekend coming to an end, she doesn't want to waste time embracing her desire to not only merge but being with her brother without the sense of moral responsibility.

Nicole frowns, feeling a little jealous now. She too feels a little uncomfortable not being merged but she bears with it knowing that she can't ignore her own life and duties.

She loves her son, now more than ever but she can't exactly approach him the same way as she is now. She understands what Emily is feeling and going through right now.

However...

"Emily, Arianna...I'd like to remind you that we should all take Scott's feelings into account as well. If you're merging just for him, then that would be a little selfish wouldn't it?"

Even though Nicole says that, she knows she isn't one to talk. When the time comes, she couldn't back down from merging with Arianna despite her son's initial discomfort and conflicted emotions.

Arianna and Emily look at each other, hum and then stare at you with expectant eyes.

You feel suddenly pressured but you have no doubt that if they were to merge, it would produce a beautiful fusion and you could get along with that girl easily if history is to be accounted for.

"I...don't mind."

Saying it as non-committal as possible, the two girls smiled widely and then giggle towards one another in delight.

"Let's go to the amusement park then!" Emily suggests.

Arianna isn't against the idea as she sighs. "That sounds wonderful actually."

Nicole, feeling left out, tries to bury her emotions and coughs. "You two can merge after we eat breakfast. Then, I want you back here before it gets too late. Both of you have your own school and I need to make sure I have time to drop off Arianna."

Both girls hum and respond at the same time, "Yes, mom."

Arianna pauses and blinks a few time before blushing as she realized her error. "A-ah, I mean...Thanks, Nicole."

Nicole feels rather uplifted by the pleasant accident and chuckles. "Dear, you don't have to worry. In a way, you're part of our family now so you're like a daughter to me."

Arianna lowers her head in embarrassment but hums with a small smile. "Um...thank you."

You blink, taking in this sight. 'She's...actually quite cute.'

It's definitely a far cry from when she threatened your mother to merge although, you had a feeling that was the necklace corrupting. Now that there's an embracement of the necklace and understanding of one another, you can perhaps see why someone would want to date her.

With the plan set, Nicole prepares breakfast for everyone. Given that you were going out, you rechanged into something more suitable and while Emily and Arianna were in another room preparing, you see your mother staring absent-mindedly into the television as it plays some drama. It doesn't appear she's really paying attention.

You frown, feeling like there's an elephant in the room that needs to be discussed. Taking your mother's feelings into consideration started this whole thing as you didn't want her to be hurt. Now, it feels like you need to reassure her.

"Um...mom?"

Nicole blinks and then snaps out of her stupor, then forcing a smile towards her son. "Oh! You look quite handsome there, sweetie."

You blush but not letting yourself get distracted, you press on. "Mom, no matter what, I just want to let you know that I love you. That's all."

Nicole smiles sadly and then turns off the television with the remote with a sigh. "I...I know this is fucked up, son."

Hearing her being up front, you widen your eyes and step forward. "N-no! It's not-"

"Sweetie, you don't have to cover for my selfish feelings," she interrupts with a hand raised, "...I want to say that these emotions are brought on because of the necklace, but I sometimes wonder if that's false and I'm just a...horrible mother."

"Mom!" you shout, not wanting to see her wallow, "...you're not horrible! You raised all of us and I...I couldn't be more proud!"

Nicole lip's curl and her eyes warm, "Sweetie, thank you..."

She then shivers and hugs herself, emitting a deep sigh before continuing. "...but I'm...scared."

"Scared?"

Nicole nods. "Being with you as Angeline felt like a dream that I didn't want to wake up from. Even if Angeline and the other fusions exist more individually than we thought, it doesn't feel like we're completely separate. I've had the thought to throw everything away in my life to become Angeline. She can provide you more love and care than I can ever hope for. As I am right now, I'm just your mother but as Angeline, I'm more."

You felt yourself shake and you could understand her completely well; however, you couldn't let her despair like this. Forcing yourself to move forward, you give her a surprise hug.

"S-sweetie," she shakes, her hands sliding over your back and her voice cracking, "...please don't worry. I'm strong, I promise! I-"

You gently pecked her on the lips, causing any further words to fall. Pulling away while your face deepens red, you hoped that would ease some of the discomfort she was feeling.

Nicole lets out a shaky breath and stares at you, her face conflicted but she smiles easier now as her heart relaxes. Both of you struggle to say something but ultimately, Nicole speaks up.

"Thank you, sweetie."

You gulp, wondering if you did the right thing but seeing your mother relax more, you feel like your actions are justified.

Actions speak louder than words and no matter how wrong, you couldn't allow your only mother to let her existence be second to a fusion.

"You're..." you begin, trying to find the right words, "...my only mother and you can't be replaced. Believe me, I won't allow it!"

Nicole feels tears welling her eyes and she rubs it, trying to laugh it off. "You...look at what you did! You're making your mother cry here."

You chuckle and hug her once more, feeling a small weight gone on your shoulders now. Breaking this touching moment though, you clear someone new clear her throat.

Blinking, you and Nicole turn to face a new girl who is standing near the doorway with an expectant smile. Once more, you feel your breath taken away.

Preview  

Seeing your reaction, the obvious fusion between Arianna and Emily hums, satisfied. "Well, I was going to ask how I look, but I guess there's no need."

As you take into her form, you could only comment on one thing.

"Er...I figured you'd be blonde."

The fusion widens her eyes incredulously. "Seriously? Is me not being a blonde a problem?!"

You shake your head quickly and stutter. "N-n-no! I mean, all the other fusions up until Selena were blonde, so I figured that Arianna would dominate in that regard."

The fusion chuckles at such minor detail. "Who knows how the necklace determines our forms. Now, let's not waste any time here!"

Despite being older and more mature, Nicole could feel her young spirit rising as she pouts in jealousy. She tugs on her son's shirt.

"Just remember sweetie, Angeline is better."

Hearing this, the fusion scoffs. "Oh screw you!"

Despite the disrespect, Nicole laughs and then shoos you and the fusion away. "Just go you two. Have fun...but not too much!"

Feeling self-conscious now that your in the midst of another beauty, you try to not to freak out or grin stupidly as you approach her.

It feels as if the fusion could see through you though as she smirks and takes your hand, pulling you closer.

You gasp in response as she flushes against you and presses her lips upon yours. Letting out a pleasant grunt, your stupid grin reveals itself as she breaks away.

"Allow me to introduce myself now," the fusion begins with a twinkle in her eyes, "...I'm Emila. Ready to go?"

Emila...

You repeat the name in your head and then nod dumbly as she locks her hand with yours. On her other hand, she has the keys to your father's car. It would seem she's taking it upon herself to drive.

First impressions matter and Emila definitely didn't fall behind in that aspect.

Before closing the front door, Emila calls out to Nicole. "Oh, I left the necklace in Emily's room by the way! Maybe you can spend some time with Rebekah when she gets back!"

Nicole gasps and widens her eyes. "N-no, how could I-"

The front door closes before she could finish and she frowned in dismay. Jealousy begins to fill her as she wanted to go with the amusement park with you too.

Shaking her head silly, Nicole sighs. 'What am I, in my twenties? Get it together, Nicole. Let's just clean up the house for a bit then maybe take another nap. Ugh...I feel like the pain medicine is starting to wear off.'

What's next?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Emily is still feeling daring. She wants to mer...

choices: A mysterious woman who also had a necklace!
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Having arrived at a popular amusement park, you find Emila just as dreamy as the other fusions. It occurs to you that between every fusion so far during this weekend, your inhibitions towards them have been low.

That is, despite Emila being a half-sister to you, she doesn't feel like she's related to you at all. The same goes for Angeline who despite retaining some of that maternal personality, she too doesn't feel like your mother.

Arianna and potentially other strangers might provide the catalyst in suppressing that sort of familial aura. Honestly, it's hard to gauge whether or not it has nothing to do with Arianna presence and only changes in yourself.

"Hey, what are you thinking about?" Emila asks, her head nestled on your shoulder as she grazes your chest.

Shivering, you bring her in closer to you as you watch the sky grow bigger and then smaller. At the moment, she and you are on a Ferris wheel.

"It's nothing," you answer, not wanting to spoil the mood with your ever-growing curiosity of the necklace.

Emila hums, not satisfied. She draws her finger along your stomach causing you to jump and try to suppress your own giggling.

"H-hey, cut that out!" you gasp as the fusion laughs.

"You know," she begins, drawing her face closer and sneaks in a kiss which you accept gratefully, "...even though we're not merged, I'd like us to be open to each other's thoughts and worries just as if we had exchanged our minds with each other. Besides, at this moment, I'm your girlfriend, right? Don't you trust me?"

Girlfriend...

You feel like such a happy dork to hear that from this beautiful girl. If she weren't a product of the necklace, you might never have the confidence to approach her or any of the fusions for that matter.

Since her persuasion is top notch or because you can't resist her charms, you give in to her easily.

"Well..." you begin, "...I was just thinking that between you, Angeline, Ellie, and even Selena, I haven't felt truly uncomfortable around any of you. When I think of how I tried to resist Emma's approach, I wonder if Arianna is the reason."

Emila hums, suddenly conflicted now as you revealed your thoughts. Thinking on it, she gives her own opinion.

"Well, I don't think that's bad. I'd like it if there weren't any boundaries between a fusion and you, but if it means Arianna becomes part of our family, I'm for it."

You raise an eyebrow. "Why?"

She smirks and kisses you again, causing your mind to fog. "Silly, because then I can exist to see you again."

You blush, then try to cough the feeling of embarrassment as her words struck you deep. Ending on that note, you hear the Ferris wheel operator call through intercoms.

"Alright, folks! That's a wrap! Hope you enjoyed!"

Hearing that, Emila is rather disappointed and then sees the sun beginning to set. Time really flies when you're having fun.

Seeing her disappointment, you try to cheer her up. "Hey, we can go on one more ride at least!"

Exiting the cart, you and Emily ignore the bewildered and jealous stares of those waiting in line. Thinking, Emila suddenly stops and then smirks.

"Actually...I do have one ride I'd like to try..."

You widen your eyes and feel an auspicious delight about to come.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

The final ride begins in the parking lot as your father's car begins to creak. Inside, you and Emila become one in the best way possible without the power of the necklace.

On top of your lap with her bottom sufficiently flushed your crotch, she bounces while producing sweet breaths. While your hips move on their own, you take pleasure in wrapping your arms around her petite form and burying into her chest.

"Oh god, Scott! Yes! I love you! I love you so much!"

Hearing her affection, the result of many fusions and pleasant memories cause you to gasp and your mind to cloud so easily.

Holding out your best, eventually, both you and she reach the climax and your voices sync together as you groan loudly inside the car.

Those passing by on the outside could easily hear the noises even if the windows were tinted. It was obvious what is going on and especially those with families made sure to steer clear.

When Emila suggested this final "ride", you wanted to chicken out as you worried about getting into trouble. This sort of near-public affection could only be called risky and you had a feeling it was brought on through your sister's influence.

Still, you couldn't resist the fusion and the opportunity to dig in just as you had with the rest of the fusion girls. After ten minutes, both you and Emila finally finish.

Breathing heavily, she kisses you deeply for several long seconds before getting off of you. While smiling unevenly, she strokes your arm.

"Want to go again?"

You stare at her in disbelief. Looking at the sun set further in the distance and the fact that more people are exiting the park, you gulp.

"U-um...it looks like I'm out of tickets."

Her lips turn sly, approving of your clever response. "Well, I'm sure we can go for another ride free-of-charge."

You breathe exasperatedly, thinking how unbelievable this girl is.

Unbeknownst to both of you, someone watches your parked car in the distance with great interest. Waiting for you to begin your car ride home, she lets out a heavy breath.

"I found you~"

Who would trail them?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Onward to the amusement park! Follow Emila and ...

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Two days ago...

Gina lied in a rocking chair in deep thought as she nursed her son, Chris. Staring out in the window, her face fills with pain at the thought of the company party she attended.

It felt unreal, but the conflicting emotions in her heart proved that it was real. In just a few hours, she had learned to appreciate her new son who had become smarter thanks to the incident. While he couldn't speak, his eyes were filled with understanding everywhere he looked. He cried less and although he couldn't control certain aspects, it was getting better at an abnormal rate thanks to the awareness.

As for her, she also found a new love for Scott...one that cherished him as the one responsible for gifting such a beautiful perspective for her and her baby boy.

His presence became like a brother to Chris and...she wanted him to join her family on an official level. She could become his mother...and more.

At its peak, that desire had costed her and only after a day of wallowing and getting through the aftereffects of the necklace did she realize she went overboard.

Why did she not chase after them? After all, she had memories of their address.

If it was only her, she might have chased them like a madwoman but thankfully, Chris reminded her that she couldn't ignore what bond she already had.

Still...she couldn't forget about them. Even though how she went about forcing the marriage of their family was wrong, she still wanted to integrate.

So, she decided she had to act carefully. She had to find the right opportunity to appeal to Scott, Nicole, and their family.

Looking at Chris who was suckling quietly, she smiled warmly at him and cooed. "Don't worry, baby...our lives will become more complete. Isn't that right?"

Chris giggled incoherently as if acknowledging.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------

In between her workdays as a receptionist and taking time off, she would drive by their house and monitor their movements.

She understood she was stalking, but she wasn't sure she should be walking up to the door and knocking...no, not after what she has done.

If preferrable, she wanted to find time to meet with either Nicole or Scott alone, but there wasn't much opportunity.

Now, she found herself watching what could only be Scott and another girl making out in their car. Although it was hard to see, there was no doubt what was going on with the rocking movements of their vehicle.

She was at least glad she left Chris with his nanny. The one thing she swore to herself was to at least protect him better given she made some irresponsible decisions in the past. Merging with Nicole for those few minutes had given her some insight into being a proper mother, which she'll always be grateful for.

Aside from that though, she was feeling rather jealous of what was going on. It might be wrong...disgusting even, but she wanted to be in that place with Scott. The feelings were complex, but the necklace left her wanting some form of bonding.

She waited patiently as the sun was drawing down when suddenly the door opens. The woman got out saying something incomprehensible given her distance, but it looked like the girl was going to come back soon.

Her eyes widen. This might be her only chance!

Getting out of the car, she stopped from shutting the door to notice gleaming on the girl's neck as she traveled across the parking lot. Her heart beat as a familiar sensation filled her.

'The necklace!'

There was no doubt which meant that girl had to be a fusion!

Biting her lips, Gina had a choice. What does she do?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Gina!

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Although it was tempting to follow the necklace, she shook her head and her eyes focused on you who hopped back into the front seat, waiting for the girl to finish business.

Stepping out, Gina walked carefully. She knew that her presence would probably be disconcerting, but she had no choice. If she did nothing, it would be even worse.

Taking a small breath, she closed in on the car and as you were playing with your phone, a knock on the window causes you to jump.

Turning your head, your breath halts as you recognize what could only be Gina. She looked apologetic and before you could say anything, she spoke clearly so that you could hear her from behind the window.

"Scott...I want to talk, please."

What do you do?
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Gina approaches you.

choices: You decide to invite Gina over for dinner.
For now, you decide not to push things too far. You give Gina your cell number.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
If you thought logically, there's no way you could drive away especially since Emilia is out there. In that case, leaving her with Gina will be dangerous.

There was also an emotional response. Even though you thought you could forget her, seeing her now makes you reminded of your bond with her. Even though what she did was wrong...you were even worse for nearly following along.

Taking a deep breath, you step out. Although you were nervous, you felt emotions bottling up that would explode if you didn't face her properly. You'd definitely not be able to sleep if you tried to run away.

"Gina, um...hi?"

You greet her awkwardly and tried to ignore the fact that she could've had her eyes on you for a while.

Gina fidgets. "Scott, I'm...sorry."

The first thing that came out of her mouth wasn't an equal awkward greeting but a straight-to-the-point apology. Seeing her expression filled with regret and sadness, you couldn't hang on either.

"N-no! I'm the one who should be sorry! I-"

Blurting out so suddenly, Gina was surprised as she blinked but quickly regained her composure. Almost losing it, you hold yourself back and grow red with embarrassment.

A moment of silence descended between you two before Gina forced a laugh. "What's done is done, right? There are also things I have to thank you and your mother for. My relationship with Chris has become much better. Before meeting you, I was filled with stress and anxiety but...I've come to enjoy being a new mother."

"A-ah, that's good," you answer, forcing a smile, then look behind her. "Uhm...did you bring your son?"

Gina shakes her head. "I left him with his nanny. Moreover, I wasn't sure if meeting you like this would be safe but I..."

She takes a deep breath, shakes, but resolves herself. "...I had to meet you. Scott, I...these feelings inside me won't go away. When I see you, I...I feel like I'm seeing a long-lost son of mines."

"G-gina..."

You felt sympathetic and understand that it wasn't her fault. The necklace affects everyone differently and brings out emotions that don't seem to go away.

Gina shakes. "I...I'd like you to give me another chance. What I did was wrong, but my intentions...I want our families to be closer. I can't help it!"

You hold your breath, then gulp. Unsure of what to say, you only stare dumbly at her, trying to formulate a response.

If you thought back, you had to accept your actions. Angeline and the other fusions helped you understand yourself better in regard to the bonds that develop.

"I...I wanted that too."

Admitting it to yourself, the sensation of being bonded with Gina and then having her fuse with your mothers brought a scary acceptance that haunted you.

Hope fills Gina and she stepped forward. "Then-!"

Quickly, you raise a hand to stop her. "...W-we can't do things willy-nilly though! I...I've decided that we can't lose ourselves in the process of bonding. So, I can't make any decision by myself...no, I refuse to do it."

Gina pauses and hearing your honest feelings, she could admire it. Taking a step back, she sighs. "I understand as well. Then, we can take things in step, can't we?"

Quirking your eyebrow, you looked on at her expectantly as if she had a plan in mind. "Yes?"

Gina hums. "I...owe your mother an apology. If I could meet her even if she rejects, I'd be satisfied."

You understood. If you thought about it, you and your mother gave Arriana a second chance which turned out producing a beautiful batch of fusions. If that were to mean anything, then it might not be far to see Gina truly integrated with their family.

"Huh? Who is this?"

A voice breaks in between the mood and you see Emilia back, staring at Gina with suspicion. At first, Gina remained silent, unsure how to react but soon Emilia widens her eyes as her aggregated memories recalled.

"Oh...you're Gina, right?"

"Yes, and you are...?"

Emilia smiles, her expression friendly. "Emilia...I'm a fusion of Scott's best sister and Arianna...you know? The one who you were going to eat up, right?"

Okay...maybe not so friendly.

Gina froze. She took a step back. "I-I wasn't myself. I just wanted to be..."

With her shaking, you felt the need to intervene. "Emilia, it's fine. We both regretted some things and she had a lot of time to reflect."

Emilia crosses her arms and rolls her eyes. "Whatever. Let's just leave her, okay? She's not part of our family."

You curl your lips, then decide.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.title: Hear her out.

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Although Emilia's words were harsh, she had the right to be upset given Gina was the one who has forever messed with what could have been a normal life for Arianna.

Yet, it's also hypocritical given Arianna also took things too far as she was corrupted by the necklace, willing to blackmail your family.

"Emilia, I'm not saying you should easily forgive, but...you wouldn't be here if things didn't play out the way they did. Also, Arianna also forced our hands, remember?"

Emilia widens her eyes, shocked. She wanted to argue but had nothing to refute given how things indeed turned out.

Continuing, you stare at Gina who couldn't help but avert her eyes. "It's not my total decision, but since she was already influenced by the necklace, I want to give her a chance as well...just like we did with Arianna."

Emilia sighs, "So what? We're going to add another person?"

Gina finally speaks up, not willing to play the third wheel like this. Raising her hands, she shows a reassuring smile. "Talking with you like this is more than enough, Scott. I know I caused trouble! At least, I would like to leave with a good conscience on my mind, that's all."

While Gina only wanted to tie loose ends, something deep in you was perhaps desiring more. This line of thought is quickly squashed by you though, knowing it might not be any good.

"Let me call mom. Maybe...you could join us for dinner?"

Gina blinks, surprised by the offer but she shakes her head. "I don't want to impose, Scott! I want to apologize for your mother, but that doesn't mean it has to be now!"

"That's right! Hey!"

Emilia agrees and grabs your arm, stopping you from picking up your phone. You are about to protest until you see her pleading eyes.

She bites her lips, then lowers her voice. "Scott, I get it. You...feel something right? For this woman? As a fusion with Arianna, I admit it, okay? I'm glad that Arianna wasn't shunned because that means I can be with you in this world. I just..."

She hesitates and sighs. "...it just feels like, the family plus Arianna is becoming a little more stable. I'm worried that if we bring her into this mix, it'll become more unstable. Aren't you concerned?"

You curl your lips and nod. "I am, but...both Arianna and Gina had time to adjust after the effects of the necklace. We all did, in fact. Something is telling me it'll be okay."

Emilia hesitates before glancing at Gina, clearly troubled yet undeniably hopeful too. Even though she didn't want to impose, she knew she'd feel at least better at night knowing that she at least apologized to Nicole.

Sighing again, Emilia lets go of you and crosses her arms. "Fine, do what you want but let's not waste too much time...after all, my time here is limited as you know."

Right, Arianna couldn't stay at their house as she had university studies. You give a sad smile before calling your mother. Gina tried to protest.

"Scott-"

"Hold on, please."

You press her to wait at least. Now that you met Gina, you don't want this to be delayed. The sight of her was enough to rekindle bonds created by the necklace and you might end up losing sleep just as she did if you prolonged this.

"S-sweetie, hi!"

Nicole sounds a little frantic on the phone.

"Um...is everything okay?"

"Yes, I just woke up from a strange dream...yes, that's it. Forget about that, is everything okay with you and um..."

"Emilia?"

You could hear Nicole grunt and sigh. It would appear keeping track of the fusions is beginning to strangle her.

"Yes, your sister and Arianna, right? Everything is alright? You two should be coming home by now. I have to drop off Arianna soon."

You hum. "Right, but um..."

You glance at Gina who stood uncomfortably.

"...well, we met Gina."

You hear silence from the other end.

"G-gina? N-no, are you okay?! I-"

"M-mom, hold on!" you cut off before sighing.

"She...wants to apologize. Maybe I can put you on speaker?"

"A-apologize?"

"Yeah..."

Another moment of silence, before you hear her hum affirmatively.

Suddenly put in the spotlight, Gina is shocked but can't do anything to prepare as you place the phone on speaker and she hears Nicole's voice.

"Gina?"

Fumbling for a bit, Gina finally found her footing as she let in a breath of air.

"Nicole! I'm...I'm sorry for approaching your son, but...I want to apologize to you and him. Trying to force myself upon you was inexcusable and for that, I'm sorry!"

"..."

Clearing your throat, you add. "Mom, I've already accepted her apology but...she's not at fault compared to how I-"

"Sweetie," Nicole's firm voice rang causing you to flinch, "...you've blamed yourself enough; I get it. Gina, I will also apologize to you for how things went...after all, I was the one who allowed my son to merge with the first person in that bathroom at the party."

Gina freezes then let out a breath of relief. She felt like crying but held on. "Thank you."

It looks like some of the weight on her shoulder will have eased. Now for perhaps the hard part.

"Mom, this may be sudden but...maybe we can invite her for dinner?"

At the very least, this might be a more reluctant case but you had a stronger bond to this woman than Nicole did. To both you and Gina's surprise though, Nicole agreed easily.

"Sure...I think that's for the best if we all got together and talked things through."

After some silence between you and Gina, Nicole asked. "Is that alright with you, Gina? I know you have a baby to take care of-"

"No, that's fine! Thank you! I'll bring my son along as well."

The 180 in attitude surprised you, but considering she had been hoping to meet in person, it seems she would gladly take the offer now that it was available to her despite thinking she might be imposing.

Nicole let out a chuckle, "Alright then. We'll be glad to have you! Scott, Emilia...come home safely, please."

"Right, we will."

After reassuring, you end the call and look at Gina who was a great happier than she had been before. It just showed how much the necklace bonds she had been forcefully removed from had been eating at her.

Taking your hands suddenly, you gasp but couldn't pull away as Gina held them warmly. "Scott...thank you."

Seeing her smile, you blush a little, then cough. "Um yeah. We both should get going. I don't think I need to tell you our address, right?"

Gina chuckles. "Of course. I'll be there in a couple hours! Thanks again!"

The young latino mother leaves with a wave.

Turning back with a sigh, you catch Emilia staring at you, peeved.

"W-what?"

"You just can't be satisfied with us, huh?"

Taken aback, you play dumb and enter back into the driver's seat of the car. "Not sure what you're talking about."

Emilia uncrosses her arms and scoffs, leaving it at that as she walks the other side.

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
Once off the phone, Nicole buries her face into her hands. There were simply too many things she had to process...too many emotions to contain. Her heart beats frantically with anxiety and yet...excitement.

The strange dream she had was none other than the same void she shared with her other children, except all of the fusions she and Arianna were a part of had come together.

It was rather odd...but fun. They played some cards while talking about life, their existence, the necklace, and various theories.

Despite Angeline, Ellie, and Selena being fusions, they had as much clue as their family regarding the necklace. Where had it come from? Who had used it before? What will their family life be like from now on?

One big question was whether if there were more fusions in this strange mindscape. The commonality between all three of them was Arianna of course, but why would only their branch exist so far?

Selena appeared to have more insight given she composed of Scott, one who had questioned the most...

"Maybe...we can exist because we've been accepted? I feel like Arianna and your family will remain close from now on, so we'll come back in some form again, I'm sure."

Selena's words in the shared mindscape struck a cord with Nicole, one who had been struggling all along.

Acceptance.

Certainly, she had accepted Arianna despite what she did. In such a short time, the girl became almost like a daughter to her. Another reason perhaps is thanks to her son's acceptance and the love that came about between him and Angeline.

Thanks to that, she almost wanted to merge with Arianna forever, just so she could exist as a girl and relive this feeling of love, one that just felt...right.

But that would mean losing herself. What about Daniel? What about being a true mother to her son and daughters? Angeline would never be able to take on that role because of Arianna and her feelings for Scott.

So while she could accept the fusions and Arianna who had blessed the newfound life, she had to...no, she must coexist along them for the sake of her family...and herself.

Then, leading up to the problem that she is beginning to regret: Gina.

While she may have forgiven Gina, only because she couldn't blame her, there is a part of her who is scared to completely accept her.

She remembered the feeling when Gina forcefully fused with her and then, "her" words to Scott:

"Scott, my son… I feel whole again. I will be your new mom."

After that moment, she could feel her son's unwillingness to accept this change but it didn't last too long. She could see it in his eyes that after becoming part of Gina, he wanted it...he wanted this new perfect mother. Compared to Angeline, the desire and love that formed was much different.

Alone, Nicole could never be this perfect mother and she certainly couldn't be someone like Angeline either. Perhaps that's why she slowly felt herself swaying...nearly mentally merging with Gina so it would be all finalized.

Yet, Scott pulled away from his selfishness, bringing Nicole back into the world. Still, he blamed himself, but knowing the joy of merging and beauty of these fusions, she couldn't blame him. Perhaps that's why, Nicole thought it would be best to invite Gina over.

She hugs herself and shivers, staring into the hallway leading to their front door. Curling her lips, she sighs.

"D-did I make a mistake?"

She keeps wondering until the door knocks where her son and Emilia comes back.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------

There was some reluctance to part, but not nearly as bad as previous fusions. Nicole watched as her daughter and Arianna split inside of Emily's room given the likelihood of one of them being naked. As she watched them unmerged, she wondered if she would see Emilia in the mindscape next time.

The possibility that there would be more names to remember made her sweat a little, but she decided against thinking about it.

Breathing out as if being reborn, Arianna slid to the floor nude and coughed while Emily swayed a little, but remained on her feet with the dress of the former fusion.

Nicole quickly moved to support Arianna. "Sweetie, are you okay?"

The college girl coughs again, then stands back up on her own, waving Nicole off. "I'm...fine...Just dizzy."

Emily looked to be stabilizing much quicker and blinked a few times before she pouts. "This sucks."

Arianna simply laughs as she goes to take back up her clothes left on the couch. She understood Emily as if she were still a part of her.

"It was fun, but your mom is right. I do have classes tomorrow and so do you all."

"Ugh..."

Not having the stamina to argue, Emily let it go and washes up in her bathroom leaving Nicole and Arianna.

Biting her lips, Nicole asks worriedly. "Will you be alright?"

Arianna hums as she pulls up her underwear and slips on her previous jeans before turning her head towards the mother. She gives a crooked smile.

"Well, I'll manage. Don't worry. That said, I really wish I could stay for dinner."

Nicole curls her lips, wishing as well but she knows that it might be dangerous, especially since Gina would be arriving soon.

Somehow, Arianna understood this as well but seeing Nicole's reaction, she provided some reassurance.

"I think it'll be fine with Gina, Nicole. With your daughter, Emilia was a little harsh, but I'm thankful for having the chance to be with your family. Gina looks like she would feel the same way."

"Thank you, Arianna. Truly, being with you has become one of the happiest moments in my life."

Arianna blushes a little and then clears her throat. "It was mine as well. Scott too...he was lovely."

Nicole felt proud and ashamed suddenly. Not wanting to dwell on memories fused, Nicole cleared her throat and left the room. "I'll be out in the car when you're ready, okay?"

Arianna hums in response, watching the mother close the door behind her. Only a few seconds after she finishes changing, Emily busts out of the restroom crying, clinging to Arianna who quickly became like another sister to her.

"No! I don't want you to leave so soon! This really sucks!"

Arianna laughs nervously as she tried to pry off Emily. "I-It'll be okay! We'll find some other time real soon!"

This doesn't stop Emily from wailing comically and preventing Arianna from leaving the house by a few minutes.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------

What happens?
