1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
When Nicole arrives back home, she recognizes Gina's car by the front due to previous memories. Immediately, she sweats but takes a deep breath, forcing herself to remain calm.

She's the one who agreed to inviting her. Just like with Arianna, Nicole knew she had to resolve any lingering feelings. Although Gina might have calmed, she had knowledge of the necklace. They had to at least agree to keep the nature of this necklace a secret.

Entering her home, her heart beats slightly nervously. The feeling of her body being taken over, no control, and nearly losing her mind to Gina still stuck with her. Just thinking about it makes her equally guilty for taking over Arianna.

"I'm home!" she calls out.

"Over here!"

Hearing her eldest daughter, Rebekah call out, Nicole enters the family room where she sees everyone sitting at the couch. The necklace lies on the coffee table in the center.

Although Nicole thinks it's risky to put such a powerful item in front of Gina, she sees the young mother wasn't too focused on it. Rather, her attention was all on her.

Standing up with her baby in her arms, she lets out a silent gasp.

"N-nicole."

Nicole smiles wryly, but knows she can't let her inner feelings go on display. Rather, she sees the mother a little shaken and it's clear she was unsure how to begin.

Being a mother herself and her maternal instincts kicking in, she opened her arms and hugged the woman, to calm her down.

"Hey, it's fine," Nicole whispers.

Gina takes a shaky breath before she places one hand around Nicole's back and keeping her baby, Chris close to her. "Thank you."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------

While Nicole and Gina caught up with what occurred after they separated, you and your sisters began to look at the baby Chris intrigued and worriedly.

The baby stood tall and proud, pointing at a block of numbers they had in their closet. He could understand their words and they were testing in him with simple arithmetic.

Without a problem, the baby pointed at a number or flipped the block to the correct number without fail after each one of them asked them a question.

Emily took a breath and leaned back. "Wow, this is...kinda scary."

"So he became a genius after fusing with this guy?" Rebekah asks.

You nod, rather guilty because you had encouraged it when you were fused with Gina. "It looks like it. I think we gain more than memories, but we can also increase our knowledge."

Rebekah hums, then nods. "Well, that makes sense. I mean, our knowledge comes from memories. That means you guys have my knowledge too."

Realizing this, Emily widens her eyes. "W-wait! Th-then, doesn't this mean I can pass my class easily? You were an honors student, Rebekah!"

Laughing, Rebekah has an idea and stand up. "Here, let's do this."

Slipping away for a moment, she then brought out an assignment of hers in her college statistics class. Quickly, Emily pulls away. "N-no wait-I'd rather not do any math right now! It's my worst subject!"

Rebekah smirks, "Well, if knowledge is shared, I think it'll become your best subject!"

Forcing the paper on her, Emily reluctantly views it and you slide by her, interested if you might understand some of the problems on this assignment.

Both you and Emily's eyes slowly widen with astonishment. The expression causes Chris to enter a fit of giggles and even Rebekah to curl her lips in amusement.

"Holy shit, I...I can understand this shit!"

"We're cleared!" you agree, happily.

Rebekah clears her throat. "Hey, don't get too cocky! This is MY knowledge you guys leached off of...all of my hard studies. It's unfair really. I haven't gained anything from you guys."

"Thank you, oh sister!" Emily lets go of the paper and hugs her sister, now faithfully worshiping her sister.

"Hey, let off!"

"Let's merge after this, okay?"

"Don't say things like that so casually! I've got exams tomorrow!"

You watch your sisters banter, then focus your attention on Chris who looks intrigued at Rebekah's assignment left on the ground. Quickly, you pull it away causing the baby to whimper, disappointed.

"Sorry, we're not trying to make you a super genius here."

Chris huffs rather cutely, then half walks before crawling back to his mother. Gina picks him up and holds him closely as she continues talking with Nicole.

"...to be honest Nicole, I did dream once where I met Erica. It was strange to see a form of yourself and unfortunately, I can't remember what we talked about. I never had seen as many fusions as you had."

Gina smiles sadly, rather jealous. She tries to hide it, but Nicole picks it up. "Answer me honestly, Gina. Do you still want to merge?"

"I..."

Gina hesitates before glancing at you. Embarrassed, you turn away, returning to your conversation with your sisters.

Gina sighs and equally returns her attention to Nicole. "I do...but I don't mean to force it! I get these...aches sometimes, making me want to merge with you or your son, but after a day, I'm perfectly able of controlling myself."

Nicole bites her lips, then speaks more softly. "I get it, Gina. If it weren't for my son, I'd...probably not be here speaking with you. To become another person is just a free feeling...but we can't let this get to us."

"You haven't rejected the necklace either though," Gina points out, "...and it seems that you and your son..."

Gina didn't outright say it, but Nicole understood, taking a deep breath. "Maybe it's just an excuse for my own sanity, but I didn't do anything...rather, I had become a different person when I was with Arianna. It didn't even bother Angeline that she might be his mother, she just...easily loved him more than I could as if she was unbound. It's a relieving feeling, but coming back...I know our family won't be the same."

"I-I'm sorry..."

Nicole waves her hand. "It's fine! Our family is working it out somehow and..."

Sighing, Nicole holds Gina's hand. "...I'd like to work it out with you as well, Gina."

"W-what?"

"I'm saying, as long as we agree that we'll unfuse, if you really want to fuse with me, we can."

Gina takes a shaky breath and breaks away from Nicole's hands. She holds Chris more firmly. "But...what if I-"

Nicole smiles. "I think it'll be better this time. We all have a good understanding of the necklace and I'd rather not let you struggle with this for too long. Before that though, I want my son and daughters to agree as well."

Gina breathes in, trying to calm herself down as she feeling her heart beating excitedly. "I...of course! Nicole, I'm so grateful!"

Nicole pats the young mother on the shoulder, then goes in to tickle Chris in her arms, her motherly instincts rising as she sees Chris giggle and swat her finger playfully.

"Let's discuss this later. I think my stew is ready now," Nicole hums as she stands up.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------

At dinner, Nicole discusses to her children the desire to bring Gina into the family just as they did with Arianna. Generally, what was the consensus?

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
During dinner, there was a lack of surprise on Rebekah and Emily's faces when talking about integrating Gina into their daily lives.

"Well, it was bound to happen," Emily says plainly, rather peeved but not all that disappointed.

Rebekah sighs. "So, we'll have another mother, huh?"

"Eh...I wouldn't say Angeline felt very motherly if you're counting her," Emily comments.

Nicole clears her throat, not wanting the discussion to go off the rails. "This is something I need to do, not just for Gina but for myself."

She turns her attention to you. In turn, you flinch. Although it was apparent that inviting Gina here meant that there could be fusing, to see it was going to occur started to make you nervous.

"Scott," Nicole addresses firmly, "...I know that things have been...awkward between us, but becoming part of Angeline and being with you was a dream and you accepted it so well. It made me feel so happy, even if I still feel guilt now after the fact."

"M-mom, this isn't-"

"This is different though," Nicole cuts off, "...Gina affects you differently and it might be due to how you became a mother yourself. Even if you don't want to admit it, I can see that she has made you more comfortable than I've seen before."

Your lips quiver, but you don't say anything. In the awkward silence, Rebekah coughs.

"So, what should we expect? I guess this will make Chris our new baby brother? How will you and Scott...um..."

Gina blushes and lowers her head. "I'm not sure. Back then, I desired Scott to be my n-next son after being one with him. He and I were a pair and took care of our...I mean, my baby that I felt...a bond with him. I'm not so sure now though."

Emily whistles, grinning. "Let's assume things will remain pretty strange in terms of relationships."

Rebekah nudges her sister and glares at her. "That's not something I want to hear from you, of all people."

Emily shrugs. "I think it'll be okay, regardless of what happens. I mean, our dear brother and Angeline are already an item, so it can't get any worse than that."

Rebekah narrows her eyes. "You're forgetting someone."

Emily turns away, feigning ignorance. While this talk was going on, you couldn't stand it anymore and stood up from your seat.

"I-I'm going to h-head back to my room!"

You need to get away, afraid of how even more twisted your family will end up. Yet, you couldn't take back your consent. Your mother is right, you felt something instinctual with Gina, both pure and twisted.

"Wait, Scott!"

You hear Nicole's worried voice, but you didn't turn as you left the table, quickly closing yourself up in your room so you could think more clearly.

Perhaps, you'd get used to it just like you got used to Arianna joining with your mother and sister. Although there was a tiny bit of guilt for taking advantage of your family, it never felt like you were doing something unforgivable. Rather, Arianna felt like the catalyst that made things feel okay; as if there wouldn't be any consequences.

Gina might be like that too, but this is a young mother, not a college girl who was only a few years older than you. Things would naturally turn out differently.

"Scott?"

A knock on the door causes you to gasp, then you notice that Gina had come up to you alone. Feeling obligated to address her as a guest, you allow her to come in.

"C-come in."

"Sure..."

You could hear Gina's nervousness in her voice, but she also sounded so hopeful.

Entering, you see the latina girl and in the background, you hear Chris in the background giggling as your sisters played with him.

"Scott, if you don't want this, it'll be okay. I...I don't want you to hate me. If this feels uncomfortable, I'll just leave. Thanks to you, it's already enough that I was able to sort things out and talk honestly with you and Nicole."

You curl your lips, before sighing. "I...I'm worried obviously, but...I'm willing to try just like how things turned out with Arianna."

Gina smiles easily, her heart singing. A little of her maternal affection for you leaks out as she breathes. "Sweetie..."

You grow embarrassed and on cue, Nicole comes in, then slowly closes your door. "Scott-"

"I'm fine," you quickly interrupt, knowing she's worried and steeled your heart, "...l-let's just get this over with."

Nicole was taken aback, but seeing her son's eyes, she nodded and took out the necklace from her pocket before facing Gina.

"U-um...hold up, let me leave first-"

Before you could leave your room, not desiring to see the merging process between your mother and Gina, the necklace shined brightly as if reacting to the will between Nicole and Gina.

It caused the three of you to freeze before Nicole turns her head to you and smiles curtly, "S-sorry Scott, it doesn't look like we can stop this."

Those were famous last words from your mother before she and Gina gasps as a invisible force pulls them together.

You stare, in shock and a little afraid. Having witnessed Arianna and your mother merge for the first time and momentarily looking like a ghoul which scared the living shit out of you, the imagery has caused some fear of seeing future fusions.

You wouldn't be able to stop yourself from seeing this one however and while not as grotesque, there was something disturbing as you watched Gina and Nicole blend together.

First was their heads as their faces flew into each other, becoming abstract and less defined as their hair dissolved. Despite the lack of mouths, you could hear Gina and Nicole's moans.

Working its magic, the necklace then pushed together the rest of their bodies. Either still aware or the doing of the necklace, Gina and Nicole wrapped their arms around each other. Slowly, you could see the clothes of the two women being stripped by the same invisible force that pushed them together.

"Sc...ott..."

A voice croaked from the amorphous flesh being, a blend of Gina and Nicole. You tug on the bed, unable to stop staring as your heart beats faster.

Fully together, yet with no definitions, you flinch as the merged flesh of the two suddenly slam into the wall, then drip down into a puddle of goo with no end to the moans of pleasure between them.

This is the first time you saw the foundation completely lose itself. They were both at a perfect point where they could start reforming, yet they suddenly went kamikaze!

'What the...'

The unsettling feeling inside of you grew, now regretting allowing yourself to give into these emotions of desire. It was obviously too late to stop anything though as the fleshy puddle that is your mother and Gina let out another groan in sync.

Then, you hear Gina's voice...not aloud but within your mind, echoing without warning.

'Yes...yes! Nicole, your memories...I feel them...oh...your family is so...warm.'

You shiver, wondering what's going on. There's no answer, but you feel a higher sense of awareness to both Gina and Nicole...having been a part of them both.

'Our sons...daughters...are beautiful'

This time, you hear Nicole's voice, hearing affection from her so rare that you had to do a double-take. This only makes you grow even more worried about the merging process which is becoming more bizzare.

'I have to move...this is getting crazy! Move Scott!' you scream in your head, wanting nothing more than to bolt out of the door before witnessing what might come next.

As if hearing your voice, both Nicole and Gina called to you in your head and in sync.

'Where are you going, sweetie?'

You gasp, then look to the puddle which had disappeared in your moment of distraction. You feel power returning to your legs and try to move, but then a shadow entered your range.

Your feet frozen again, you feel your body being pressed and suddenly pushed to your bed. Before you could scream, something slithered over your mouth and between the creases of your clothes, removing them.

Realizing it's the blob that is your mother and Gina, you panic and try to wriggle free but it's futile.

'Shh....it's okay...oh...my sweet son...'

You hear Gina and Nicole's voice again, but more melded now. Mentally, they were almost there to completion.

This doesn't match any sort of beautiful form you expected and instead felt like something out of a horror film.

Unable to scream, you let out a weak gasp as your view is covered in darkness by the both of them in their undefined, yet malleable form. Enveloped by them, you start to hear something familiar...

Ba-thump...ba-thump

Ah...it's a heartbeat.

So loud, yet oddly soothing, your mind tries to recall this familiar feeling. It's almost as if you are in...a womb.

Maybe you're just hallucinating or perhaps you're just unconscious and dreaming. Either way, you hold no more power to struggle and let yourself relax to the beating heart.

The last sensation you could feel before your mind drifts completely is a soothing warm hand on your forehead, traveling through your hair.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------------------------------

When you come to, you find yourself...

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
As you wake, the sounds of seagulls and the ocean crashing against the shore and rocks enters your ears. The air smells of the salty sea and you feel a warmth emanating onto your skin.

Grunting, you open your eyes then hear a familiar voice.

"Hey there, sleepy head."

Lifting yourself up, you notice you're on some sort of bench covered with a soft blanket. Opening your eyes, the sudden beach matches with what you imagined. To your further surprise, you see Angeline adjusting her hair from behind, then smiling at you.

Preview  

Her eyes narrow and the edges of her lips turn to form a smirk. The dumbfounded look on your face explains everything.

"Not sure what happened?"

You gulp, then shake your head. You couldn't even form words to express your confusion. You were certain that you were in the middle of witnessing Nicole and Gina's merging which really went south...or at least you thought so. Now, you're at some beach with Angeline.

Looking around, you could see some buildings in the distance. It appears you are in some sort of coastal city. The next thing you also notice is that aside from the ambient noises and the ocean, it's oddly quiet. There wasn't anyone on the beach except for you and Angeline.

Angeline hums, then giggles. "How about you first guess where we are?"

"Uh...California? Did I just get drugged and flew away here?"

The beauty laughs, then shakes her head. More serious this time, she stands up and gazes out to the ocean.

"This is the same dream-land that is created from the necklace, Scott."

You widen your eyes, then stand up as well, taking in the world around you in more detail. While you couldn't believe it as it felt so real, there were also odd details that you couldn't ignore.

No people on this perfect sunny day, no apparent cars driving in the distance. It appears just solemn and quiet.

"How...why am I here?"

Angeline doesn't answer immediately as she frowns, then stares at you bitterly. "Well, it sort of just happened after you allowed your mother and Gina to fuse."

"What?"

You stare at her in disbelief, but she had no reason to lie. Explaining properly, she sighs.

"I was with my fusion sisters. We even talked with your mother earlier and played some cards. If it isn't obvious now, it seems we're able to exist beyond Earth which is nice considering I was afraid I wouldn't exist after I defused.

"Then...things changed. I really want to punch you for letting Gina enter our inner circle! Neither you or your mother heeded my warning!"

Seeing Angeline's sudden frustration, you step back and raise your hand in defense.

"W-what warning?!"

Angeline grumbles in disgust before raising her voice. "Just letting new people fuse into existence! I can tolerate Emilia because this is your sister and Arianna, but...not this...."

Her voice grows quickly soft. A sadness envelops the girl and you feel your heart tighten in guilt. Unsure what to do and still very confused, you take a step forward to try to console her.

"A-angeline, I..."

The girl quivers before taking initiative, burying against you and wrapping her arms around your back. You are surprised at first, but quickly comfort her and wrap your arms around her, trying best to ignore her large chest smooshing against your bare chest.

You only notice it now, but it appears like Angeline, you have popped in with a suitable swimming trunks. It of course does nothing to hide your arousal as you feel your third leg bumping against the girl. Your best attempts at ignoring her round globes proved to be an instant failure.

Growing embarrassed and cursing yourself, Angeline lets out a short laugh, then breaks away and wipes a small tear from her hide.

"Pfft....you really know how to read the mood."

Hiding your boner, you sputter. "S-sorry."

As lame as you are, Angeline seems to not mind and laughs easily. Of course, this girl knows you very well thanks to your mother such that she loves your faults too.

After recovering, Angeline grows quiet, then breathed out some honesty. "I really missed you."

Inhaling, you hold your breath, trying to hide an upcoming embarrassed smile. Clearing your throat, you hum. "Yeah...me too. So, you were saying?"

Angeline nods, feeling less irritable than before and continues. "Right, after Gina and your mother merged, the rest of us got separated as we were thrown into this new expanded world. It was frightening, but I was able to gather what I could do here and what changed.

"There's all sorts of shops and places here, yet nobody to operate anything. It's strange and lonely, but I have a feeling that within this city, the other fusions are out there."

Blinking, you feel rather overwhelmed with this new information, only proving that there's so much more to the necklace that you aren't aware of.

Angeline grabs your hand and squeezes. "Scott, somehow...I was able to sense that you were around and found you lying on this beach. I was so relieved! I want to find my other sisters that were developed from me, but so far I haven't had any luck."

"Wait, how much time had passed?"

Angeline bites her lips, then shakes her head. "I...I don't know. It's never gotten dark around here."

Back at your home, you let out a sigh as you lie on your bedside, dazed. Nina had left the bathroom and your room to attend to Chris who began to cry downstairs. After the merging, Nina apparently took out one of the cribs you or your sisters had and used it to give the baby some sleep. After that, it was all attending to you.

Now that she had to attend Chris, you had time to think more clearly.

But think about what? Nina, although truly affectionate and even a little uncomfortable at times, is as lovely as Angeline and the other fusions.

Truly, there hasn't been a bad fusion! Could there ever be?!

'No, no-I should stop there' you think to yourself, laughing.

What happens?

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
"W-where am I?!"

"Mama, mama!"

"Honey, where are you?!"

"Oh god, this can't be happening! What about my 6:00!?"

As panic surrounded them in every direction, Emily and Arianna kept mum, their face growing paler and paler the more people that started to pop up. There were people who seriously thought they had died and others who were still in fright over the "thing" they saw.

Neither Emily nor Arianna could count...no, they didn't want to count. This is literally the worst thing that could have happened.

"Um...excuse me? You two are rather calm. Do you know what happened?"

A lady in business clothes floated towards the two and a nearby nurse who also kept silent and calm, only because she had a head start in arriving into this mess.

Yet, this woman while she was initially speechless, seemed to be rather good at keeping herself composed even though it's apparent there's worry in her eyes.

"N-no, sorry..." Emily answers to the businesswoman, feigning ignorance just as she had done with the rest.

The woman sighs before lifting her head and placing a hand to her forehead. "...and here I was trying to be a hero. How foolish."

The nurse fidgets, clearing her throat before she calls on the woman. "Um...you are?"

The businesswoman blinks before growing embarrassed and laughs. "Oh! Sorry, I'm Sarah Wood. I was caught in what I think was a car accident caused by that blog thing."

Despite the dire situation, somehow...this woman was still able to laugh. This surprised Emily and Arianna,

Thinking about it, Arianna recalls she heard that name somewhere ago. After a few seconds, she gasps. "W-wait, I know you! You were presented in The Seaside magazine as one of the top ten women in business!"

Emily eyes widen and the nurse quickly composed herself as well, recognizing the woman in front of her as a positive advocate for getting women to start their own businesses. Before being hired as the CFO for one of the largest accounting firm, Sarah had helped shaped up all sorts of startups as an accelerator and guide.

Sarah smiles, somewhat embarrassed by the amount of her publicity. "Well, you haven't told me your names. It seems you three have been here a while."

"U-um...I'm Emily, in my third year of high school at Josselin."

"I'm Arianna, I'm a student studying in finance at Clarke University."

"I'm Vivian - just the head nurse at Josselin high school. Emily and I were together before we were taken by the blob."

Sarah smiles sadly. "I'm sorry. I really hope this...place isn't what I think it is. I'm glad you three are composed..."

She turns around and looks at the various people, some of whom were relieved to find their families that had also been taken in. She speaks softly.

"...Right now, I think the most we can do is stay calm. We have no clue what's going on and causing panic is probably not the best thing to do."

Emily and Arianna nodded, but her words only make them guilty as they might be the only one with a better clue what's going on.

"Emily...Arianna...you're fading!"

Vivian gasps as she calls to them, her panic coming back again.

Both girls looked at each other for a moment, seeing that they are becoming increasingly transparent. What shocks them though is a growing shared sensation that only existed when they were conscious and fused.

They only shared a breathless sound before they completely disappear. Seeing their empty floating places, Vivian quivers and Sarah let out a shaky gasp.

Others witnessed the disappearing two and thinking it might be them next, some of them cried...truly believing themselves to be dead.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------

The scream was sharp as you heard Nina downstairs. Your heart beats fast before you quickly rush down to the first floor, only to witness two blobs attacking Nina.

She struggles to shake them loose, but in front of Chris, who begins crying in his crib again, she is unable to resist as the blobs envelop her curves and start fusing.

Nina's screams turns into muffled moans before her human form began to disintegrate.

You stare in shock as the blob began to kneed itself, looking like ball of dough. Between its self-kneeding, two different moans sounded out and he recognized them to be Arianna and Emily.

"What the fuck..."

He couldn't help but express his disbelief. Quickly, he looked around for a necklace and then saw the glowing jewelry glowing on the kitchen table.

if the necklace was here, how could Emily and Arianna returned? He understood a lot of time had passed since he woken up.

With so many questions racking his brain, his attention was brought back to the ball of growing flesh and then, something unexpected happened.

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
What is a fusion?

Well, obviously a combination of two or more things.

Thus, when it comes to a fusion of two or more people, one would expect that the result would require the whole components, right?

Once again, just when you think you're starting to understand the necklace, it turns out you still don't know anything. It's power, it's reach, it's consequences...there were still lots to learn.

So, when you witness the formation of not one, but three separate fusions splitting from the blob and becoming more humanoid, it left your jaw open.

Nina had disappeared and if you were to believe Arianna and Emily had become the two blobs, then you would have expected an entirely new fusion, but as the details of the forms emerged, you see a familiar pair of blondes and one brunette.

Angeline, Ellie, and Selena.

The last one completely blows your mind, considering Selena is supposed to comprise of you...and yet, here you are.

"Wha...how..."

You stare dumbly at the three as they slowly open their eyes, confusion overwhelming their expressions.

"Ugh..."

"W-what just-"

"S-scott?"

Each of them turn around, confused by the sudden shift in location and by the familiar person they all developed to love. Angeline is the first to get her bearings, somehow excited to see Scott again yet not enough to keep her from first questioning.

"W-we were just talking to each other in the necklace's world. If we're all here...are we still in the necklace?"

"I...I don't know," you answer, still dumbfounded.

Are you in the necklace world? That would make sense, but you don't remember falling unconscious or being transferred. As far as you know, this is your home.

Ellie furrows her eyebrows and examining the familiar home, she then places her hand on her stomach. Slowly, her eyes widen.

"I feel...Emily...Nicole...Arianna. They're...we're one again. Their minds, their presence..."

Angeline gasps, feeling the same thing with the exception of Emily. "H-how? How can we both feel Emily and Nicole?!"

"Me too, except..."

Selena looks up at you anxiously and the answer is clear, she too feels Emily, Arianna, and Nicole...but not you. Her existence just complicates everything.

You start to laugh, rather distressingly causing the three to feel startled. Angeline quickly rushes to your side, seeing that you're about to pass out.

"Scott, don't go out like this! We can figure this out! What happened before us appearing?"

You gulp, trying to find words. After taking a breather, you and the three settle on the couch. While being surrounded by naked beauties is great, you hardly had the time to get excited.

"Um...two blobs came, I think Arianna and Emily. They...they ate Nina and split. I...I don't understand! My sister and Arianna, they were nowhere near the necklace!"

Silence reigns and the three fusion sisters looked at each other before some idea comes to their mind. Ellie is the first to speak.

"Angeline, didn't this happen right after we all wished we could exist here?"

"But how?" Angeline asked back, curling her lips.

Searching through, Selena came up with a theory. "I'm noticing something...while I do feel Nicole, Arianna, and Emily, it's not a strong sense of feeling. In fact, I feel more like we do when we're in the necklace, separate from everyone."

"I feel this as well," Ellie answers.

Angeline closes her eyes and sighs, placing a hand over yours then smiling apologetically. "Sorry Scott, it seems we greatly disrupted something."

"Well um...it doesn't look like you guys knew. So does this mean, even any of us could be far away, the necklace will respond to your guys' wills as well?"

"It looks like it. Seems far too coincidental considering we all were together at the time," Selena hums.

"Oh, Scott...this is great news though!" Angeline cheers, moving in closer to you.

You blush, growing aware of her body. Coughing, you try to remain composed. "W-what?"

"More of the fact that Selena is sitting here with us proves that our existences aren't dependent on you or anyone! We could be with you on a more permanent basis!"

The idea causes your heart to beat - to be with these three beauties and others? Could it be possible?

Ellie frowns, then clears her throat. "I...don't think so, Angeline."

Angeline widens her eyes and stares at her fusion sister surprised. "Why not?"

"How could we form our bodies from nothing?"

The questions stumps everyone in the room. Where would their foundation be to exist on a physical level?

Selena nods while humming. "I think we can agree that the necklace at least creates a copy of us. That's why we can exist within the necklace, but since we were born from Arianna, Nicole, and Emily in some fashion, we would need them as part of us."

"Oh, you two with your geeky theories are ruining what's present!" Angeline shouts, growing frustrated before she locks your arm, trapping it in between her breasts.

You shiver and after thinking you might be done after Nina, your lower half creates a tent.

"A-angeline, I think we-"

Angeline presses a finger to your lips, then smirks. "I think you should call me Mommy, since it seems you swing that way after what I saw with Nina."

You choke and Angeline giggles, caressing your cheeks. "I'm kidding, Scott...come here."

Taking the lead, you could only grunt in exasperation as Angeline gently locks her lips with yours. Meanwhile the other two frowns, jealousy emerging in their hearts.

Ellie speaks up first with a growl. "Oh come on, Angeline! You had him before and even went on a date with him! Let us try!"

"Unf..." Angeline moans a little as she breaks away from you, leaving a bridge of saliva between you and her. As you sway, dazed and stupidly happy, Angeline turns to Ellie with a cheeky grin.

"Oh? Am I not technically the oldest one here? You and Selena are still children in my eyes."

"Oh, stop it with that mother card. You've already played that once! Also, I'm taller!" Ellie bites back.

"What does that have to do with-"

"Guys, wait!" Selena shouts, her eyes rather distant but seeing the two banter, she felt frustrated. Something inside she was feeling worried her.

Everyone quieted down, staring at Selena as she furrows her eyebrows. "I...think our fusion and split caused more of a mess than we realized. It's disconnected, but...don't you feel others?"

Disconnected, as in they weren't part of their core pieces that make up themselves, yet...there's still an attachment. Searching themselves, Ellie and Angeline widens their eyes in horror.

"Oh shit."

Horny, you manage to try to remain calm amid the seriousness then look at the three confused. "W-what? Hey?"

Angeline curls her lips before looking at you with a nervous smile. "Um...Scott, I think Arianna and Emily engulfed some others along the way here."

You freeze, the meaning of their words very clear to you. Twitching, you try to smile but your heart is panicking.

"H-how many?"

The three looked at each other. Between the three of them, they internally counted in their hands based on the various sensations and disconnected memories that flowed within each.

Sweating as you watch the numbers go past the number of fingers, your eyes roll up. You hear your name being called in panic as your vision grows dark.

What happens next?

1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
"Oh dear..."

Angeline lips quiver to see you pass out, but it couldn't be helped.

'This is all my fault,' she thinks, believing that if she hadn't made their existence any greater than it was, things would've been okay.

Still, worrying about the past wouldn't help now. Turning to her fellow sisters, Angeline had another idea.

"We should bring back Nina as well," she suggests.

Selena curls her lips. "Is that wise? I mean, I know we disrupted their little evening, but wouldn't that mean..."

Letting her words fall out of uncertainty, Angeline still understood what she was implying and nods. "Yes, it would mean that we would have to thin out Nicole even further between us."

Ellie frowns. "Angeline, isn't this risky? We're barely able to feel out Nicole and the others as is!"

Said fusion sighs in response, "I know but...something inside of me is telling me that she should be released. Either that or Gina herself."

Selena and Ellie blinks before agreeing somewhat. Actually, this can only be the influence of Nicole which bodes well that it doesn't seem splitting has affected her consciousness.

"Besides," Angeline continues, "...only I need to split her out somehow, so Nicole will still be majorly maintained by you two."

"I guess...but we're not sure are we? How will you even be able to split only a sixth of yourself out?" Ellie questions.

Angeline bites her lips before her eyes stares at the necklace on the kitchen counter. "Worst case, I lose myself and become someone or something else. We're already in a mess, so can it get any worse?"

"What about the others that we involved?" Selena asks.

Angeline lowers her head, but she had no good solutions now. "Right now, it's like their in limbo. If we bring them out, there'll be questions. For now, let's just try to get either Gina out by herself or through Nina."

Agreeing to that, Angeline picks up the necklace before glancing at your unconscious form. She smiles a little and pecks you on the cheeks before she holds the jewel part of the necklace tightly.

Closing her eyes, she tries to will Gina and part of herself out. How does one split part of themselves? Before any of this, she would have no clue but now that she does feel part of Nicole, it gives her a unusual sense of awareness and how it can be divided.

This revelation is a big understanding that could lead to advance fusions, but she has no idea if it will even work.

Hearing Ellie and Selena's gasp, Angeline is tempted to open her eyes, but she remains focused. The fact that she hasn't lost awareness of herself is a good thing but she does feel Gina emptying out, becoming more front and center. Nicole starts to fade from her awareness, but she can still feel a tiny of it lingering...making herself still feel connected and warm.

"Ugh...w-what...?"

Hearing a new voice really close to her ears, Angeline opens her eyes. For a moment, she's hopeful that everything has worked out, but turning her body around shows no new fusion. Staring at Selena and Ellie, she raises her eyebrows in confusion as they stare agape. Oddly, their stares aren't quite pointed directly at her.

No, it was like...

Turning her head as another groan fills her ears, she gasps as she sees Nina's head grown out from her own neck, dazed and confused.

Not expecting this conjoinment, Angeline screams.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

"Pfft...haha! The look on your face!" Ellie sputters and laughs, unable to help herself. Being comprised of Emily who would make fun of this, it isn't surprising.

At least Selena is better, but even she couldn't help keep a straight face when thinking about it.

While peeved, the conjoined state wasn't permanent and all Angeline needed to do is focus longer to fully have Nina form and split away. This process took a long time though and it was excruciating to Nina who's maternal instincts didn't lessen when it came to your health. She panicked more to see you unconscious than her own conjoined state!

Despite being reassured, Nina rudely pushed Angeline away to get to you.

Cradling you close to her on the couch, she tries to wake you up. "Scott, Scott? Sweetie, are you okay?"

Angeline furrows her eyebrows and huffs, but she could understand Nina's concerns being part Nicole. It's just she also know that this is likely not going to be the first time you'd pass out either.

"He's fine, Nina. More importantly, I think you should check up on Chris," Ellie points to the master bedroom where they relocated Chris' crib.

Nina gasps before moving to her other "son", her heart in disarray after being engulfed. With some of the maternal air lifted from their position, Angeline breathes a sigh of relief, wondering if bringing Nina out was the best idea.

What's done is done though and Angeline sits by you, nudging you a little, seeing your face twitch. "Hey, wake up Scott."

Having recovered a little, you groan and slowly lean forward, pressing your fingers to your temples.

"What happene-oh god..." you remember easily and sigh, "...t-the others that are part of you...just how are we going to fix this mess?"

That's the most biggest challenge and Angeline worried what might happen if they wait long. According to Emily's and Arianna's memories, the people seem to be in some sort of limbo. It's not like they had influence over their consciousness, but each of them could pose a risk to their identity if they aren't careful. If time went on, who's to say that one of them could spontaneously induce a merge from within?

If she had a sense of these people in limbo, it would only be a matter of time before they realize there's someone watching them as a whole...and they too would have a sense of her.

Before that, they could try to split out the people, similar to Nina but then comes the question on how to explain this whole situation. Also, could they really just spend time pushing people out?

...or could they assimilate everyone and force them to understand.

The thought makes Angeline shiver, only because with so many panicking people and various temperments, it's very well possible that Scott and others may get hurt. There's no telling who Angeline and the others might become.

"Can we maybe...transfer them somewhere?" Selena suggests.

To where though?

The necklace world? How?

The thought makes her freeze. If it were possible, would it be great? No, it's only trapping them in a much better environment but their bodies...their flesh is somehow still part of each of them.

Yet, it might give them time. Time to perhaps slowly bring everyone back.

What is decided?

choices: You agree to join in...because it's already a mess as is.
You'll stay and watch as an observer.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
What is the necklace?

Allowing two or more people to fuse together isn't just its sole definition. The more it is used, the more of its power and nature is revealed. It does not just save the resulting fusions, but it can even store consciousness of others!

Knowing that, is it possible to remove the consciousness of the many people they absorbed into the world of the necklace? It's not ideal but it would give them some comfort that they wouldn't be taken over if one of them figures out how to break through the limbo space.

They had to try, otherwise the only other option is each of them trying to force them out. Who knows how they would react and if it would be possible to control the situation.

Two people stands out in Angeline's mind according to Emily and Arianna - Sarah Wood and the school nurse, Vivian. Perhaps, they might be the two they could reveal first and hopefully gain their help. From her memories, she recalled that Sarah especially was quite calm and collected. She definitely seemed like the leader that could bring people together.

Angeline sighs, palming her head. "We have to try something. I...I'm not sure if it'll work, but we can't stand any longer."

With a pained expression, she looked at you apologetically. "Scott, I...I didn't mean this to happen."

You curl your lips and move to hug the naked woman, unable to help console her. Despite being now comprised of partial people, she didn't feel like any less of the individual Angeline.

In addition to the fact that their consciousness remains in the necklace world, it only adds to the conclusion that only their physical presence requires others...otherwise, they were their own person.

"It's alright," you breathe, trying to act calm but in truth, you were worried. Was it foolish to believe that the necklace could be kept a secret so far?

Maybe it is.

Pulling away, you clear your throat. In front of so many beauties, it would be impossible not to be aroused, yet you had to focus.

"Um...so what now? Maybe you all need to go to sleep?"

There is silence before Selena hums. "Maybe we should all merge together first, then sleep?"

Angeline gasps. "M-merge?! What are you thinking?! There's only a large group of people behind our consciousness and you think we should just merge?"

Selena frowns but before she could argue, Ellie steps in. "I think Selena is right! Besides, we have to do it anyways, right? How else are we going to piece everyone's consciousness we gained back together?"

That is true. They couldn't exactly defuse with only a portion of the family. Even if they could, it might turn ugly real fast.

Angeline sighs before nodding. "Sorry, you're right. I just..."

"I get it," Ellie interjects, "...we all wanted to remain here as ourselves and be with Scott, but we have to sort out this mess first."

At that moment, Nina comes back in carrying the baby Chris in her arms. He absolutely looked horrified to see other fusions staring back at him. Not to allow himself to cry again, he turned his head and nursed back onto Nina's chest as she cradled him.

"I heard, are we going to have to merge again? I just got here!"

"It has to be done," Angeline explains sadly, "...besides, what happened after...um...we ate you?"

Reminded, Nina furrows her eyebrows. "Oh, that's right! You interrupted my bonding time with Scott!"

Selena groans, "Oh come on! It was beyond our control!"

Nina harrumphs before she gazes at you, still worried. "Scott-sweetie, are you okay?"

You shuffle uncomfortably. The amount of maternal love overflowing from Nina really hammered you and potentially brought a side to you of wanting to be spoiled by her. Yet, you couldn't let yourself being drawn to her pace.

"I'm fine," you answer, clearing your throat.

Angeline narrows her eyes at Nina, feeling annoyed and also a little jealous. Unlike Nina, it's not like Angeline doesn't feel a maternal love for you, but she knows that your a grown man. It's fortunate that Nicole is past the age of coddling her children otherwise, she might end up like her.

"Nina, please...what happened afterwards?"

Nina held in her complaints before sighing as she felt expectant stares. "...After taking me away, everything went dark. I felt...my grip on Nicole being lost...taken away. Then, Gina also disappeared. After that, I found myself into the necklace world but I had lost my connection to Gina and Nicole. I was about to lose it until I felt myself return!"

"At least it didn't go completely dark, you should be glad that you were still able to exist like the rest of us!" Selena snorts.

"No!" Nina shouts, causing everyone to flinch, "...what could I do without being next to my familia? I don't want to be separated from them ever again!"

"Um..." Ellie hesitates before opening her mouth, "...you won't? We'll find a way to be together and you should know that Scott can appear in the necklace world too."

"What about Gina?" Angeline presses, "...did she join the others in limbo?"

Nina breathed in before sighing, knowing that she was scaring Chris, she calmed down quickly. "Yes, but there's nothing to say except she was confused and worried like everyone else inside."

"Then, let's try not to contain them any longer in empty space. It's not ideal, but at least they might have some working time on their feet in the city."

Nina remains silent for a moment before eying you. "I'll only merge with you all if Scott and Chris is joined with us as well."

Everyone's eyes raised alarmed.

"What?! Scott is perfectly fine by himself. We should not need to complicate this!"

"Yes, what are you thinking?!"

Nina defends herself. "We should be together! That's how it should always be!"

"That should be Scott's decision, not yours! YOU are not his mother! Nobody is!" Angeline exclaims.

Nina is taken aback before she pleads with you. "Scott-sweetie, I...I know that I may be overbearing, but I do love you! I can't help but feel this way due to my nature, but I...just want the best for you."

You gulp, "Um..."

Seeing your hesitation, Nina sighs. "I'll...merge with you all alone if he doesn't want to. At the very least, I want to take my baby Chris-"

"No!"

The resistance is fiercer. Even Chris looks unsure if he wants to be part of these women. Being as smart as he is, you find it a little amusing.

What happens?

choices: After fusing, the necklace stored everyone's consciousness into the world.
Unfortunately, Jane has yet to try to move the people behind her consciousness.
1212221111121112121112122123111132221113.content:
"Um...I think I'll keep out," you answer, not quite feeling as disappointed given the situation.

Nina frowns, but doesn't push back on your choice. She lowers her head and sighs. "Alright..."

Angeline nods in approval, though a tiny bit of her wouldn't mind merging with you, but now is not the right time. She addresses everyone.

"We'll have another chance if everything goes right. The last thing we want to do is bring him down with us if it goes wrong," she explains.

Everyone could agree to that. Even Nina who held you and Chris dear to her didn't want to cause more problems. Knowing this, she silently brings Chris back to his cradle, away from whatever would come.

With a shaky breath, Angeline moves to the kitchen to grab the necklace and then brings it over. Seeing that she's nervous, you want to console her more, but she tries to put up a strong front.

"Let's all remember, even if we fuse, we would still need to figure out how to bring everyone that we absorbed back for real. Let's not forget about that."

Everyone nodded. At this point, fusing parts to become a whole is only the first step. Nobody had a clue as to how to move the people behind their consciousness. They could only hope there was an easy resolution after becoming one.

Raising the necklace, Angeline clears her throat.

"Alright, um...fuse!"

...

Typically, the necklace would just respond to their collective will yet it's been seconds too long while holding it. Angeline thought she might have to explicitly declare, but still nothing. It just left her feeling embarrassed.

"Uh oh."

"Shit, now it decides to stop working!?"

You begin to sweat, wondering if the splitting of fusions was perhaps too much. Just before you could say anything, the front door slammed open.

"Good god, the fucking traffic! It was accident after accident getting here! Scott, where are you?! Arianna, she just-"

Rebekah came in, frantic but all of her next words comes to a halt as she sees Nina, Selena, Angeline, and Ellie standing together, equally surprised by her sudden entrance.

Your older sister blinks a few times, wondering if she's seeing things. "How is...but..."

Things would not make the situation easier for Rebekah to swallow as the necklace finally started to glow.

Angeline ignores Rebekah for the moment and scoffs. "Oh, now you decide to work, huh?!"

Selena hums worriedly. "Er...maybe we should fuse one at a time-!"

Suddenly without any control, the girls gasps as the necklace began to levitate in the air in between them. It's at this moment you decide to step far away from the living room and Rebekah does the same, her eyes wide with confusion.

A wind tears through the house and causes all four fusions to rise a few inches from the ground. This causes all of them to panic.

Unable to remain calm any longer, Rebekah screams as the wind howls around them like a tornado.

"SCOTT, WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON!?"

"I DON'T KNOW!" you cry back, feeling helpless. Neither you nor Rebekah seem to be affected by the necklace's pull but that doesn't make you feel any better about the sight you are seeing.

"Stop, stop! Not like this!" Ellie yells, trying to pull away.

"Scott, Rebekah...get away!" Angeline warns, her eyes quivering.

All of the fusions tried to pull away, but it was difficult when they were levitating without any control. Their protests were cut short though and you stare in shock as they are all pulled together.

Their flesh joins instantly and they quickly become undistinguishable.

The necklace then falls to the ground and with it, the wind that flowed through your house slowly begins to die down. You stare as the figure touches the ground too, slowly reforming into a new fusion.

As you stare, bewildered, you feel something hit the back of your head just a few seconds later. Naturally, things black out for you.

...

Well...it's not exactly clear, but you think you just got slammed by a kitchen toaster that was picked up in the wind.

-----------------------------------------------------------

"Scott..."

...

"Scott...Scotty-dear?"

Scotty-dear? That's a new one.

Groaning, you feel a cold press against the back of your head and a pair of hands brushing through your hair.

Opening your eyes, you see a blurry image that slowly focuses, then see yet another blonde gazing at you lovingly.

Preview  

"Hey there," the woman smiles, "...welcome back to Earth."

You stare, blinking a few times and then let your jaw open a bit as you admire who you can only assume to be the resulting fusion.

Wait...fusion of fusions? Or is it technically just the fusion of Gina, Nicole, Emily, and Arianna?

The fusion giggles at your expression. "Are you going to act like this with every fusion?"

You gulp, closing your mouth. "Um...excuse me?"

The woman stays silent for a bit, not ready to answer your confusion. She continues brushing through your hair eventually causing you to feel restless as you recall the events from before.

"Wait, I remember! Rebekah! Is she okay? What about the others that were absorbed? What happened when I was out?!"

Seeing you try to get up, you feel your head thump due to the crash and flinch.

The fusion quickly pushes you back down and you notice you've had an ice bag underneath you this whole time.
